name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted, having regard to the proposal of the Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) of 30 September 2015, to extend the term of office of the Chairperson of the EIOPA by another five-year term (C8-0314/2015)

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 Since we did not support the creation of the European Supervisory Authorities (ESA) we will not support the reappointment of presidents either.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I chose to vote for this report because approving the proposal for the extension of the term of office of Gabriel Bernardino as Chairperson of the EIOPA by another five-year term is in my view the correct decision.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of  the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA).

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒I voted for a proposal for a decision by the European Parliament to extend the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) because I believe that Mr Bernardino's work so far has justified another five-year term, at the helm of EIOPA.  Mr Bernardino's hearing at the European Parliament's Economic and Monetary Policy Committee made a positive assessment of his work, while the EIOPA Board of Supervisors made its appointment in accordance with Article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 48(1) of directives. 1094/2010, and in addition I support the extension of the mandate.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of my colleague Roberto Gualtieri's report on extending the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority.  The President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority was very pleased with his hearing by the European Parliament's Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs. The commission then approved the one-time extension of its five-year term. It was therefore voted by the European Parliament in plenary following the opinion of this committee. This report was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. There is nothing against the previous Presidency, so I am voting in favour of extending the mandate.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. On 30 September 2015, the Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) proposed renewing the mandate of Gabriel Bernardino, President-in-Office of EIOPA. I have decided to vote in favour in order to ensure the continuity necessary to ensure the maximum efficiency of the functions of this body, which under the direction of President Bernardino has reached excellent levels. I would like to end by congratulating the President on his re-election and wishing him well in his work.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. For AEAPP, we vote abstention, the profile of the current president, Gabriel Bernardino, not calling for any particular comment.

name: Javi LÓPEZ
text: in writing. U2012 I voted in favour of the fact that, following the committee hearing, in the S&D Group we consider it necessary to extend the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority (EESPJ), which was approved by a large majority of the rest of the political groups.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. This report is due to the need for approval of the decision of the Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority (EESPJ) of 30 September 2015 to extend the term of office of the President-in-Office of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority.  The first president of EESPJ was appointed by the EESPJ Board of Supervisors in 2011, following an open selection procedure, for a five-year term. Article 48(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010 provides that the EESPJ Board of Supervisors may extend once the term of office of the President of EESPJ, subject to ratification by Parliament. The Board of Supervisors proposed the renewal and, on 17 November 2015, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Gabriel Bernardino, the current president of EESPJ, at which he made a preliminary statement and then responded to questions from the members of the committee. Given that there is consensus on the president's actions, I vote favorably on the proposal to extend Gabriel Bernardino's term as president of EESPJ for another five years.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒ The Supervisory Board of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) proposed extending the mandate of EIOPA President Gabriel Bernardino, the current President of EIOPA, for five years. EIOPA's main task is to contribute to the stability of the EU financial system by ensuring the integrity, transparency, efficiency and orderly operation of financial markets. I supported the extension of the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA), Gabriel Bernardino.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 Similarly, almost 5 full years ago the European Banking Authority, the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, was established at the beginning of 2011 through the reform of the Committee of European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Supervisors and the transfer of its mandate. And, like EBA, its role is to contribute to the financial stability of the European Union. The same applies to our community insurance and pension areas when it is the name of the institution. As the number of natural disasters, various incidents and other disasters in Europe is unfortunately increasing almost every year, especially in the summer months, while the stability of the pension sector is undeniably important in any country with the existence of the pension system itself (where they still do not), EIOPA must be effective, transparent and sequential. Given that Gabriel Bernardinjo has been sufficiently successful in the last five years and, on the basis of the statute of this EU body, his term of office can be extended to another mandate, it was logical to do so.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report because I do not agree with the extension of the term of office of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted to approve the proposal for the extension of the term of office of Gabriel Bernardino as Chairperson of the EIOPA by another five-year term.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. I abstained on this report which concerned the extension of the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (AEAPP). The President, Mr. Bernardino, appears to be in compliance with the objectives set by AEAPP and his mandate does not call for any specific comment. However, we are fundamentally opposed to the role played by this agency, which is working towards harmonisation at European level.

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. \u2012 The Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) of 30 September 2015 proposes to renew the mandate of the President of EIOPA for a further five years. The rapporteur approves this decision and I voted in favour of this proposal, referring to Article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24 November 2010, which, precisely, gives the authority in question the possibility of renewing the mandate of its President.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. There are no objections to the previous Presidency. I agree with this report.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (AEAPP) was established in 2011 following the 2008 financial crisis and the updating of financial supervision failures.  This body brings together, for the insurance field, all the supervisory authorities of the participating states under the reform called Solvency II. It sends its recommendations on the methodology for calculating premium risks and health insurance reserves to the European Commission. Its objective is to safeguard the stability and efficiency of the financial system and to promote the protection of policyholders, pension plan members and beneficiaries.  In fact, it is mainly aimed at "lifting unnecessary barriers to investment", which, in my view, is the exact opposite of its mission. Companies in the sector themselves criticize the fact that infrastructure asset companies are not being monitored in this context.  Gabriel Bernardino, a Portuguese mathematician, has been its president since 2011 after working at the Instituto de Seguros in Portugal (ISP). In view of the results achieved so far, I am voting against the extension of his mandate.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. \u2012 The Board of Supervisors of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) submitted on 24 September 2015 a proposal to extend the term of office of the President of ESMA for another five years. The European Parliament voted in favour of the proposal and I followed the direction of voting in agreement with the proposal to extend the mandate.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ Following on from the Board of Supervisors of the EIOPA’s proposal to extend Gabriel Bernardino’s term of office, as well as his successful hearing before the ECON Committee, I was happy to support this extension.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. The 2008 financial crisis demonstrated the many failures of the European financial system. One of the elements was the insurance industry.  The European Union, which wants to strengthen the stability of this sector, has set up the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority. It is a body coordinating national authorities and setting regulatory and technical standards for insurance companies and intermediaries.  Gabriel Bernardino has chaired this agency since its inception. After a hearing in the relevant committee, we approved its renewal for another five years.

name: Miroslav MIKOLÁŠIK
text: Writing. \u2012 The Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority has submitted a proposal to Parliament to extend the term of office of the President of EIOPA, Gabriel Bernardino, for a further five years. An extension of the chair may be granted once and the President shall be responsible for presenting a statement and answering questions put by the members of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs. Since all the conditions for approving the extension of the term of office have been met, I am therefore voting in favour of adopting the proposal.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the Gualtieri (A8-0348/2015) report, because I support the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA).

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority was set up by Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010 of the European Parliament and of the Council adopted on 24 November 2010. Its president, Gabriel Bernardino, was appointed by the EIOPA Board of Supervisors in 2011 after an open tender procedure for a five-year term in office. Under that Regulation, the Board of Supervisors may extend the term of office of the Chairman once, provided that this decision is confirmed by Parliament. By decision of the Board of Supervisors on 30 September, it proposed extending the term of office of the President-in-Office. On 17 November, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs heard Gabriel Bernardino and in his report recommended to Parliament that parliament confirm the decision of the Board of Supervisors. I voted accordingly.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. For the extension of the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, Gabriel Bernardino, the abstention was retained, his profile not calling for any particular comment.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 In 2011, the first President of EIOPA was appointed by the Board of Supervisors for a term of five years, in accordance with Article 48(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010, and it is possible to extend its term of office for another five years, provided that it is confirmed by the European Parliament in accordance with paragraph 4 of that article. To this extent, it was proposed to extend the mandate of the current President of EIOPA, Gabriel Bernardino. Consequently, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a successful hearing in which President Gabriel Bernardino made an initial statement, following questions raised by the members of the committee. I shall vote in favour of this report, in so far as it complies with the criteria legally required for the extension of the term of office of the President of that institution.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. The proposal to extend the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority does not raise any particular objections on my part, as Gabriel Bernardino's profile does not call for comment. For this reason, I abstain.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report which ratifies the ECON Committee’s support for the extension of the term of office of Gabriel Bernardino as Chairperson of the EIOPA by another five-year term.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report on the extension of the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (AEAPP).  Gabriel Bernardino, the first president of AEAPP, was appointed in 2011 for a five-year term by the board of the supervisory authorities of that body, following an open selection procedure. The Board requested that this term be extended for five years. After a hearing of the current President-in-Office, the European Parliament's Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs approved the request.  I voted in accordance with the opinion of this committee. The mandate of President of this authority can only be renewed once, with the agreement of the European Parliament.

name: József NAGY
text: Writing. \u2012 I would like to thank Mr Gabriel Bernardino for his arduous work over the last five years at the head of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority. On the basis of the results of the last term and the hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs on 17 November 2015, I support the extension of his term of office for a further five years.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted for the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA).

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I have no doubt that you agree with me that the work done so far by Gabriel Bernardino as President of EIOPA has been excellent. That is why I urge you to vote together in a positive way for its confirmation for the next five years. I would like to take this opportunity, if the outcome of the vote is expected, to wish him well in his work.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. ‒ Taking into account the success in addressing economic and monetary issues and EIOPA's current activity in monitoring trends and risks that have arisen in cross-border and cross-sectoral levels, I support the report on the extension of the mandate of current President Gabriel Bernardino submitted by Roberto Gualtieri. EIOPA (European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority) is known to be the European occupational and pension regulator and one of the three European financial system supervisory bodies.  EIOPA's task is to contribute to the stability of the EU financial system through its integrity, transparency, efficiency and orderly operation of financial markets.  It carries out its tasks independently, objectively and in the interest of the European Union. It is necessary to have a person in this function who has shown quality knowledge of existing regulations and consistency in their implementation.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. The proposal to extend the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority raises some reservations on my part because it does not seem to me to be fully justified. For this reason, I abstain.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ Since 30 September 2015 The EIOPA Board of Supervisors proposed extending the mandate of Gabriel Bernardino, the current president of EIOPA for the next five years, following good results in the previous term, I support the proposal to extend gabriel bernardino's term as president of EIOPA for the next five years.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. - I support MEP Robert Gualtieri's report on extending the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA). Given that the first Chair of EIOPA was appointed by the EIOPA Board of Supervisors in 2011 following an open selection procedure for a period of five years in accordance with Article 48(2) of the EIOPA Board of Supervisors, Regulation (EU) No 2020/2013 1094/2010, and bearing in mind that Article 48(4) of the EIA Regulation (EU) No 2020/2013 1094/2010 stipulates that the EIOPA Board of Supervisors may once extend the term of office of president of EIOPA, I agree that Gabriel Bernardino, the current President of EIOPA, extends his term for the next five years since all legal and procedural norms have also been met.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) is a body of the European Union. The primary objective of EIOPA, which has legal personality, is to protect the public interest, contributing to the stability and effectiveness of the financial system for the benefit of the European Union's economy, its citizens and its businesses. Article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010 provides that the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA may renew the mandate of the President of EIOPA only once, subject to the approval of the European Parliament. I hope that following today's vote, the President of EIOPA, Gabriel Bernardino, will be able to continue his work with the utmost independence and transparency.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. We were asked to vote on the extension of the mandate of the President of AEAPP. It's a common procedure. It is good that Parliament has control over the functioning of the bodies dependent on the institutions.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. Today I voted in favour of the proposal to extend Gabriel Bernardino's term as President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a new five-year term.  As a reminder, the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, based in Frankfurt, was established in 2010 to prevent the risks of destabilization of the insurance sector.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. \u2012 Like the proposal on Andrea Enria of the European Banking Authority, I voted in favour of this Decision of the European Parliament on the extension of the term of office of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) - Gabriel Bernardino, for another five years, not only because I believe that his appointment followed a selection process of rigorous and transparent selection, but also because Article 48(4) itself provides for the legal possibility of extending the mandate for once. In view of the hearing held by the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs and verifying that the legal and competent conditions for the continuity of these tasks are met, there are no reasons for the adoption of the extension of this mandate by the European Parliament.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. – Since we oppose the mandate and activity of these three supervisory agencies, we have also opposed the extension of the mandate of their respective presidents.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. I voted against this report because it entails increasing the president's mandate to ensure the continuity of the functioning of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority. We cannot positively sanction the management of this Authority because it is a fundamental part of the European Financial Supervision System. This system implies a transfer of sovereignty in the field of financial supervision to authorities that lack true democratic control, resulting in financial supervision designed according to the interests of large financial sector companies. It is essential to regulate the sector to ensure the interests of the European working classes, and Gabriel Bernardino's current mandate has shown that it does not shield and extend public pension systems that can serve the interests of Europeans. That is why I have decided to vote against this report.

name: Jill SEYMOUR
text: in writing. ‒ In principle I object to the authority of the EU regulators and so cannot support the extension of the term of office. So I voted against this proposal.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted on the extension of the term of office of Gabriel Bernandino in his capacity of Chairperson of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority. The hearing in the Economic and Monetary Affairs Committee last month, combined with his work so far, has proven to me that he is competent in his position.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 Following an open competition in 2011, the President of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority (EIOPA) Gabriel Bernardino was appointed for a term of five years. Pursuant to Article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010, it is provided that the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA may, taking into account the evaluation provided for in that provision, extend the term of office of the President of EIOPA once, subject to confirmation by the European Parliament. On 30 September 2015, the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA proposed extending the term of office of EIOPA President-in-Office Gabriel Bernardino for a further five-year term. On 17 November 2015, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing of the President-in-Office and on this basis recommended that the EP extend gabriel Bernardino's term of office as President of EIOPA for a further term of office. In a secret ballot, the EP confirmed the proposal of both the Council of The Institutions and the EP Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: Writing. \u2012 I approve the proposal to extend the term of office of the President of EIOPA.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. ‒ I support the extension of Gabriel Bernardino's term as President of the European Insurance and Pensions Agency since, on 17 November 2015, The Economic and Monetary Policy Committee held a hearing of Gabriel Bernardino, the current President of EIOPA, at which he made a recital and then satisfactorily answered questions from the members of the Committee.

name: Catherine STIHLER
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour to extend the term of office of Gabriel Bernardino, the incumbent Chairperson of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA), following his statement and replies to questions posed by fellow MEPs in the hearing in the European Parliament Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs in November.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. ‒ The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) was established on 24 November 2010 under Article 48(4) of the EIOPA. Regulation (EU) No 2020/2013 1094/2010 on the proposal of the European Parliament and the Council.  The first Chair of EIOPA was appointed by the EIOPA Board of Supervisors in 2011 following an open selection procedure for a period of five years. As Article 48(4) of the Regulation (EU) No 2020/2013 1094/2010 provided that the EIOPA Board of Supervisors, taking into account the assessment, may once extend the term of office of the President of EIOPA, on the basis of that 30 September 2015, the EIOPA Board of Supervisors proposed to extend the term of office of Mr Gabriel Bernardino, the current President of EIOPA, for the next five years. I support the Proposal for a Decision of the European Parliament at first reading on the extension of Mr. Gabriel Bernardino, as president of EIOPA for a second five-year term as he has demonstrated the dedication and level of expertise needed to do his job so far. In addition, as it is a relatively new body, continuity in the form of extension of mandates opens the perspective of consistent implementation and achievement of the set objectives in the set framework.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: Writing. \ I voted in favour of extending the term of office of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA). I support the proposal for a European Parliament decision at first reading to extend Mr Bernardin's mandate for a further five years, as he has shown in recent years the high level of expertise needed to carry out his work. In addition, EIOPA is a relatively new body and continuity in the form of an extension of the mandate will contribute to the consistent implementation and realisation of the objectives set.

name: Kay SWINBURNE
text: in writing. ‒ The Chairman of the EIOPA has had an unprecedented amount of work to do during his first mandate due to the many level 2 measures that the EIOPA has drafted. Given this work is still on-going and at a crucial stage, I am happy to approve the current chairman for a second mandate in order to ensure continuity to the legislative process.

name: Neoklis SYLIKIOTIS
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 We did not support the creation of the European Supervisory Authorities (ESA) because we disagree with the way they operate. That is why we do not support the reappointment of presidents either.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 This person does not meet the conditions required for this post.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: In writing. Parliament voted in favour of extending the mandate. I also voted in favour of this election.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ I endorsed the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA). Mr Gabriel Bernardino was appointed as the first Chairperson of the EIOPA in 2011 and in September 2015, the Board of Supervisors of the EIOPA proposed to prolong his term by another five years. Prior to his current role, Mr Bernardino was the Director General of the Directorate for Development and Institutional Relations at the Instituto de Seguros de Portugal (ISP). He holds a Masters degree in statistics and optimisation, Universidade Nova de Lisboa.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I supported the reappointment of Gabriel Bernardino as President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA), as proposed by the Board of Supervisors. As the Committee has assessed that it has met the criteria for the performance of its duties during the last term, I believe that the European Parliament should accept a proposal to extend its mandate at the head of a European Union body that supports cooperation between national authorities and ensures the consistent application of EU law for the insurance and occupational pensions sectors in EU countries.  The correct performance of this function is essential because of EIOPA's powers in issuing guidelines and recommendations on the application of European law, as well as the power to investigate whether a national body is in breach of the law, i.e. whether a national authority has been able to ensure that a financial institution is compatibility with European law. Since there is no objection to Bernardino's performance of the relevant tasks, I consider that the Committee's proposal to extend his term of office is correct, so I voted yes.

name: Romana TOMC
text: Writing. I supported the report on the extension of the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) because Article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010 provides that the EIOPA Board of Supervisors may, taking into account the assessment provided for in the provision, extend the mandate of the President of EIOPA once again after prior approval by the European Parliament.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. – Since we oppose the mandate and activity of these three supervisory agencies, we have also opposed the extension of the mandate of their respective presidents.

name: István UJHELYI
text: Writing. \u2012 Under Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010, the EIOPA Board of Supervisors may, taking into account the assessment referred to in this provision, extend the term of office of the President once, subject to the strengthening of the European Parliament. The reporter, Gabriel Bernardino, president of EIOPA, proposed extending his term of office for a further five-year period. I voted in favour.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. – Since we oppose the mandate and activity of these three supervisory agencies, we have also opposed the extension of the mandate of their respective presidents.

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour because I approve the proposal for the extension of the term of office of Gabriel Bernardino as Chairperson of the EIOPA by another five-year term. The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) was established as a consequence of the reforms to the structure of supervision of the financial sector in the European Union. The reform was initiated by the European Commission, following the recommendations of a Committee of Wise Men, chaired by Mr de Larosière, and supported by the European Council and Parliament. This authority plays an important and responsible role and after the hearing with Gabriel Bernardino, at which he made an opening statement and then responded to questions from the members of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs and after a careful evaluation, I believe the approval was justified.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: in writing. Taking into account that the European Insurance and Retirement Pensions Authority has proposed extending Mr Bernardino's mandate and that the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs has approved this proposal, I consider it necessary to vote in favour of that decision.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: Written. 'I voted in favour of the five-year extension of the mandate of the President of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, as this seemed to me to be the most appropriate choice.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. \u2012 This is an extension of the mandate for the position of president of an institution that was created as part of an economic integration process with which we do not agree. We have nothing against the person itself nor is it relevant for us to give an opinion on their personal and professional qualities. We are sure that it will faithfully carry out the functions for which it will be in charge, that is, to contribute to consolidating the class dominance of the financial sector and the large economic groups that effectively command this EU.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. There are no objections to the previous Presidency. I agree with this report.

name: Marco ZANNI
text: in writing. \u2012 A Microprudential Supervision System at European level was created at the end of 2010, consisting of the European Banking Authority (EBA, based in London), the European Financial instruments and markets Authority (ESMA, based in Paris) and the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA, based in Frankfurt).  In 2011, the presidents of the three Authorities were appointed, for a five-year term renewable only once. The Board of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority has proposed renewing the mandate to Gabriel Bernardino. The European Parliament's ECON Committee only held a hearing of the candidate, and then voted last week to renew the mandate by a very large majority.  I voted against, firstly because of an almost automatic method of renewal with no real motivation; Moreover, the role and value of these authorities has so far proved to be rather marginal, and therefore to continue in the path of five unsatisfactory years certainly does not seem the best decision that could be taken.

name: Inês Cristina ZUBER
text: in writing. The first President of EIOPA was appointed in 2011 for a five-year term. EIOPA is one of three authorities that are part of the European Financial Supervision System (ESFS). EIOPA aims to support the stability of the financial system and the transparency of markets and financial products. It also seeks to protect policyholders and members and beneficiaries of pension schemes. Creating the illusion that the problems that led to the 2007/2008 financial crisis are resolved, the ESFS has not changed the fundamental issue of financial speculation, as it has not put an end to derivatives markets and tax havens and has not established the separation of commercial banking from investment. History will show that the creation of these European authorities was of little value.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. I voted against this report because it means increasing the president's mandate to ensure the continuity of the functioning of the European Securities and Markets Authority. We cannot positively sanction the management of this Authority because it is a fundamental part of the European Financial Supervision System and the functioning of stock markets. This system implies a transfer of sovereignty in the field of financial supervision to authorities that lack true democratic control, resulting in financial supervision designed according to the interests of large financial sector companies and, in particular, large market speculators. It is essential to regulate financial supervision to ensure the interests of the European working classes, and Steven Maijoor's current mandate has shown that market regulation is not guaranteed to stop the financial speculation being projected for the Capital Market Union. That is why I have decided to vote against this report.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. I objected to Steven Maijoor's five-year reappointment as head of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA).  The latter has indeed distinguished itself by its proximity to the City. For example, it has delayed the implementation of the EMIR Directive by one year and is currently delaying the entry into force of MiFID 2.  By dragging things out, the AEMF is playing the game of London market operators who refuse any market regulation.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ This vote was taken by secret ballot. However, in the interests of democracy I should confirm for the benefit of my constituents that I voted against.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. On 24 September 2015, ESMA's Board of Supervisors submitted a proposal to extend the term of office of the current President of ESMA, Steven Maijoor, for a further five years.  November 17, 2015 The Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with the current chairman of ESMA, Steven Maijoor, during which the Chairman gave an introductory speech and answered questions put by committee members. I support the proposal to extend esma President Steven Maijoor's term of office for a further five years.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. If I voted to extend the mandate of the current President of the European Banking Authority (EBA), I voted against the reappointment of Steven Maijoor as head of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA, ESMA in English: its very pro-City positions have, for example, led the AEMF to delay the implementation of the EMIR directive by one year and to delay the implementation of MiFID 2. While the Commission prepared the text in 2010-11 for adoption in codecision in 2014, an entry into force in 2018 shows that the AEMF is dragging things out, to the benefit of market operators in London who fear this regulatory overload. Moreover, the mere fact that such an important text can come into force only after nine years illustrates the structural dysfunction of market regulation as organised by the European institutions.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. Steven Maijoor, Current President of the AEMF, was appointed in 2011 for a five-year term. In accordance with the regulatory requirement, the AEMF's Supervisory Authority Council may propose a five-year extension of the President's term once with confirmation from the European Parliament. This request was made and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs, after hearing from the person concerned, gave a very positive opinion. I approved this extension.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: in writing. – Since we oppose the mandate and activity of these three supervisory agencies, we have also opposed the extension of the mandate of their respective presidents.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the report on the extension of the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority. It was appointed after an open selection procedure and the Authority's Board of Supervisors proposed extending its mandate to continue working on it and to build a true European Securities and Markets Authority.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. I voted against extending the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA), Mr Steven Maijoor. Indeed, the latter, the great defender of the all-powerful City, led the AEMF, for example, to postpone the implementation of the EMIR directive by one year, as well as to delay that of MiFID 2, two regulations providing for the restrictions on players in the derivatives markets, which, let us recall, are largely responsible for the subprime crisis. However, the Commission prepared this text as early as 2010-2011, with a view to a codecision procedure, that is, involving the Council and Parliament, scheduled for 2014. Yet the AEMF is trying by all means to postpone its entry into force, still delayed to 2018 at the latest news. This delay is only to the benefit of London market operators, who are worried about the requirements for new bonds that would frame their actions. Finally, it must be noted that the slowness of the procedure in this case shows the reluctance, even the failures in the field of market regulation, contrary to the will shown by the European institutions.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 Although there is nothing objective to justify my opposition to the renewal of the mandate of the President of the European Financial Instruments and Markets Authority (ESMA), I opposed this measure in order to express my disagreement with the economic policies of the European institutions.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I have supported the extension of Steven Maijoor's term as Chairman of the European Securities and Markets Authority for another five years, considering the support received by the European Parliament's Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs following his appearance on 17 November and having passed the scrutiny by the members of that committee.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted on this report because it was approved by Parliament for the extension of the term of office of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA). The Chair of ESMA was appointed by esma's Supervisory Board in 2011, following an open selection procedure, for a term of five years, which may be renewed once, subject to the consent of the European Parliament. On 24 September 2015, ESMA's Board of Supervisors submitted a proposal to extend the term of office of the current President of ESMA, Steven Maijoor, for a further five years and informed the European Parliament accordingly, which parliament approved the extension of its term of office.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: Writing. As the previous two decisions to extend the mandate, I also supported the proposed extension of the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA). I was persuaded by the findings of ESMA's Board of Supervisors and their proposal to extend the mandate of the previous ESMA President, Steven Maijoor, for a further five years. Mr. Maijoor has done his work of great quality to this past, so I have no reason not to trust him for another five years.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. The purpose of this report is to renew the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority for five years.  Under the leadership of Steven Maijoor, the AEMF is doing all it can to delay the application of guidelines binding stock market operators who fear any regulatory overload. They thus managed to delay the implementation of the EMIR Directive by one year and to delay MiFID 2. These delays illustrate the dysfunctions that exist regarding the regulation of financial markets. I therefore voted against extending his term as head of the AEMF.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. \u2012 The extension of the term of office of the current President of the European Securities and Markets Authority, Steven Maijoor, by another five years, following an evaluation by the committee responsible, ECON, must be supported in order to allow for a continuation, as well as to ensure efficiency in terms of the functioning of this institution, which is why I voted in favour of this report. Any change in the management of an institution may lead to changes in the way it operates. ESMA is the European authority that strengthens coordination between national financial market regulators and ensures consistent application of EU financial legislation in the Member States.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. \u2012 The first President of ESMA was appointed in 2011. The Board of Supervisors may renew the term of office of Steven Maijoor, who is currently in office, for a further five years. Our delegation has no particular personal criticism of the present chairman. There is no doubt, however, that our position is totally contrary to the economic policies of the European institutions and, consequently, we can only see ourselves opposed to the renewal of the top position of the European Authority for Financial Instruments and Markets.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. – I voted against the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) A number of these regulatory bodies were set up after the financial crash, the stated aim being to regulate the financial markets so that another financial crash would not happen. Of course, robust regulation is required but there are critical concerns with these bodies. There is a huge democratic deficit running through these bodies and moreover, a number of legal concerns have been voiced. The bodies have very fragile legal foundations and a number of legal experts have stated that the setting up of such bodies was done outside of the confines of EU Treaty law. To explain simply, when an EU body is being set up, you have to first go back to the primary treaties which founded the EU and look at the Treaty provisions. If there is no provision in the Treaty to set up such an initiative, then it can be declared as ultra vires i.e. to be outside of EU law and have no legal foundation. Therefore, it was for these reasons that I voted against the extension of the ESMA.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ Following the recommendation of the Board of Supervisors of the ESMA and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs I voted in favour of the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of Steven Maijoor as the European Securities and Markets Authority. His performance was satisfactory and it is appropriate to allow Mr Maijoor to continue his work.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 The renewal of the mandate of the President of ESMA took place in accordance with the same rapid procedure as that of the EBA, without any real analysis of the work of the Agency or its President. For these reasons, I voted against renewal.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 We support the extension of the mandate of esma's Chairman having regard to the report of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs, as well as the fact that esma's first Chairman was appointed by ESMA's Board of Supervisors in 2011, following an open selection procedure, for a period of five years, in accordance with Article 48(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1782/2003. 1095/2010. We also took into account the fact that on 24 September 2015 ESMA's Board of Supervisors proposed extending the term of office of Steven Maijoor, President of ESMA, for a further five years.

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 The proposal to extend the term of office of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority is a formality without any particular implications. However, since I was opposed from the outset to the creation and operation of this principle, I preferred to abstain from voting on this proposal.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of reconfirming Steven Maijoor's term as President of ESMA for another five years. I also considered the hearing on 17 November 2015 to be exhaustive, during which Maijoor made a preliminary statement and answered all the questions put to him by the members of the committee.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. \u2012 Steven Maijoor is most warmly congratulated on his appointment as President of ESMA.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. – I voted in favour, on the basis of a positive recommendation in September 2015 by the Board of Supervisors of the ESMA proposing this extension in the term of office of Steven Maijoor, the incumbent Chairperson of the ESMA, and the decision dated 17 November 2015 by the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs following a session held with Mr Maijoor with the members of the same committee. The Board of Supervisors of the ESMA is best placed to judge the competence of the person and alternative scenarios.

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing. \u2012 A Microprudential Supervision System at European level was created at the end of 2010, consisting of the European Banking Authority (EBA, based in London), the European Financial instruments and markets Authority (ESMA, based in Paris) and the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA, based in Frankfurt).  In 2011, the presidents of the three Authorities were appointed, for a five-year term renewable only once. The respective boards of supervisors have proposed renewing the mandate to both Andrea Enria (EBA), Gabriel Bernardino (EIOPA) and also Steven Maijoor (ESMA). The European Parliament's ECON Committee only held a hearing of the candidates, and then voted last week to renew the mandate for all three by a very large majority. We voted against, firstly because of an almost automatic method of renewal with no real reasons; Moreover, the role and value of these authorities has so far proved to be rather marginal, and therefore to continue in the path of five unsatisfactory years certainly does not seem the best decision that could be taken. So even today I am voting against.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. I voted against this report because it means increasing the president's mandate to ensure the continuity of the functioning of the European Securities and Markets Authority. We cannot positively sanction the management of this Authority because it is a fundamental part of the European Financial Supervision System and the functioning of stock markets. This system implies a transfer of sovereignty in the field of financial supervision to authorities that lack true democratic control, resulting in financial supervision designed according to the interests of large financial sector companies and, in particular, large market speculators. It is essential to regulate financial supervision to ensure the interests of the European working classes, and Steven Maijoor's current mandate has shown that market regulation is not guaranteed to stop the financial speculation being projected for the Capital Market Union. That is why I have decided to vote against this report.

name: Pál CSÁKY
text: Writing. – The Paris-based European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) was set up in 2010 to preserve the stability of European financial markets and to address shortcomings in European financial supervision. The Authority shall facilitate coordination between national regulatory authorities in financial markets and ensure that EU countries apply EU financial legislation consistently. In 2011, following an open tender procedure, esma's first president was appointed by esma's supervisory board for a five-year term of office under Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010. The Regulation allows the term of office to be extended once for a period of five years. In September 2015, esma's board of supervisors recommended extending the term of office of Incumbent President Steven Maijoor for another five years. The Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs approved the proposal to extend the term of office after hearing the President of ESMA. The EP plenary adopted the proposal, and I voted in favour of it.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the reappointment of the Chairperson of the European Securities and Markets Authority. In 2011, Steven Maijoor was selected to be Chairperson of the European Securities and Markets Authority for five years. Following a suggestion by the Board of Supervisors of the ESMA, the Committee on Economic Affairs invited Maijoor to the European Parliament in order to discuss a five-year extension of his mandate. I approved this extension.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. This report proposes the positive opinion of the European Parliament on the extension of the mandate of the President of the European Financial Markets Authority (ESMA), Steven MAIJOOR, for a further five-year period.  According to European rules, the president of the AEMF is elected by the Board of the supervisory authority. The latter is also entitled to reappoint the President for an additional term, which requires prior evaluation and approval by the European Parliament.  On 17 November, Members of the European Parliament auditioned the President-candidate. Since it has met the expectations of MEPs, I support this report which is in favour of extending its mandate.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. The purpose of this report is to extend the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA). In particular, given the many positions taken in favour of certain financial centres and the fact that the Authority has delayed the process of monitoring financial markets, I voted against this report. Indeed, I have long advocated regulation of financial markets, which have too often led to reprehensible excesses.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 We are voting against the extension of the term of office because the person in question does not fulfil the conditions required for that post.

name: Luke Ming FLANAGAN
text: in writing. – I voted against as I believe this position should not exist in  the first place.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 I support the extension of the term of office of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the extension of the term of office of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) because that person does not fulfil the conditions required for this position.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ Having regard to the proposal of the Board of Supervisors of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) of 24 September 2015 to extend the term of office of the Chairperson of the ESMA by another five-year term (C8-0315/2015) and following the ECON hearing, I support the extension of the term of office of Steven Maijoor as Chairperson of the ESMA.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 On a proposal from the Supervisory Board of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) of 24 September 2015, extending the term of office of the President of ESMA for a further five years (C8-0315/2015), establishing a European Supervisory Authority (European Securities and Markets Authority), having regard to Article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24 November 2010 amending Decision 716/2009/EC and repealing Commission Decision 2009/77/EC, article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010 provides for the application of article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010. It is therefore appropriate to provide that 'the Board of Supervisors may, taking into account the assessment [referred to in this provision], extend the term of office of the Chairman once, subject to the strengthening of the European Parliament'. On 24 September 2015, the ESMA Board of Supervisors proposed extending the term of office of The Incumbent President of ESMA, Steven Maijoor, for a further five years and informed the European Parliament accordingly and on 31 December 2015, the Commission informed the European Parliament and the Commission of its resolution of 24 September 2015 on the extension of the term of office of the President-in-Office of ESMA. On 17 November 2005, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs heard Steven Maijoor, President-in-Office of ESMA, give an opening statement and respond to questions put by the members of the Committee, approve the proposal to extend the term of office of ESMA President Steven Maijoor for a further five-year period and instruct its Chairman to forward this decision to the Council, the Commission, ESMA and the Governments of the Member States. As stated above, I voted in favour of the proposal.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: in writing. I voted in favour of extending the term of office of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) considering that he was appointed after an open selection procedure, for a five-year term, and that ESMA's Board of Supervisors proposed extending Steven Maijoor's mandate for another five years.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: Writing. I voted today in favour of extending the term of office of the Chairman of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA), as I believe it is right and important to continue the good and successful work of European SMEs.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. After an in-depth review, I have agreed to extend the term of office of the Chairman of the European Securities and Markets Authority.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ Given the satisfactory results of the hearing organised on 17 November 2015 in the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs with Steven Maijoor, incumbent Chairperson at the European Securities and Markets Authority, I decided to give my support to the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of ESMA.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. Since we oppose the mandate and activity of these three supervisory agencies, we have also opposed the extension of the mandate of their respective presidents.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the reappointment of the Chairperson of the European Securities and Markets Authority. In 2011, Steven Maijoor was selected to be Chairperson of the European Securities and Markets Authority for five years. Following a suggestion by the Board of Supervisors of the ESMA, the Committee on Economic Affairs invited Maijoor to the European Parliament in order to discuss a five-year extension of his mandate. I approved this extension.

name: Nathan GILL
text: in writing. ‒ Secret Ballot!  Why oh why do the EU fear transparency?  We voted against!

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted for the report including the proposal of the Board of Supervisors of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) of 24 September 2015 to extend the term of office of the Chairperson of the ESMA by another five-year term.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 Since we did not support the creation of the European Supervisory Authorities (ESA), we do not intend to support the reappointment of presidents either.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for this report as I am in favour of approving the proposal for the extension of the term of office of Steven Maijoor as Chairperson of the ESMA by another five-year term.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of  the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA).

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for a proposal for a decision by the European Parliament to extend the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA), because I believe that this allows for the smooth continuation of the work of President Steven Maijoor and the Authority itself.  I believe it is very important that such authorities do their activities in as efficient and consistent a way as possible to justify their existence. I believe that Mr Maijoor was successful in this, and therefore I support the opinion of the European Parliament's Economic and Monetary Policy Committee and the proposal of the ESMA Board of Supervisors to extend the mandate of its President.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of my colleague Roberto Gualtieri's report on extending the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority.  The President of the European Securities and Markets Authority has been heard by the European Parliament's Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs. The commission then approved the one-time extension of its five-year term. It was therefore voted by the European Parliament in plenary following the opinion of this committee. This report was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. There is nothing against the previous Presidency, so I am voting in favour of extending the mandate.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. On 24 September 2015, ESMA's Board of Supervisors proposed renewing the mandate of Steven Maijoor, President-in-Office of ESMA, for a further five years. Given that ESMA, in years of severe financial crisis and major movements that have gone through and conditioned the activity of the financial markets, has been able to carry out its control and guarantee task in full, in order to guarantee the stability of the market itself, I express a positive opinion towards this measure. I therefore vote in favour of the proposal and congratulate Steven Maijoor on renewing his presidential term.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. For the AEMF, we are voting against the reappointment of Steven Maijoor, whose very pro-City positions have, for example, led the AEMF to delay the implementation of the EMIR directive by one year and to delay that of MiFID 2.

name: Javi LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the fact that, following the committee hearing, in the S&D Group we consider it necessary to extend the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA), which was approved by a large majority of the rest of the political groups.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. This report is due to the need for approval of the decision of the Board of Supervisors of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) of 24 September 2015 to extend the term of office of the President-in-Office of the European Securities and Markets Authority.  The first ESMA President was appointed by ESMA's Board of Supervisors in 2011, following an open selection procedure, for a five-year term. Article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010 provides that ESMA's Board of Supervisors, taking into account the analysis made by the Board of Supervisors, may once extend the mandate of the President of ESMA, subject to ratification by the European Parliament. The Board of Supervisors proposed the renewal and, on 17 November 2015, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Steven Maijoor, THEMA's current chairman, at which ESMA made a preliminary statement and then responded to questions from committee members. Given that there is broad consensus on the President's actions, I welcome the proposal to extend Steven Maijoor's term as ESMA president for another five years.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I supported the extension of the mandate of ESMA's European Securities and Markets Authority President Steven Maijoor. ESMA's main task is to contribute to the stability of the Union financial system by ensuring the transparency, efficiency and orderly operations of the system.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 The primary players of the economies of the modern world's capitalist countries are often large corporations whose functioning is based directly on the securities system. On the other hand, in view of the whole series of corporate scandals over the last decade and the increasing need for effective regulation of the market economy system itself, the functioning of the European Securities and Markets Authority is undoubtedly very important. ESMA's activities and powers are based on the pre-existing Committee of European Securities Regulators, the creation of which was previously proposed by Baron Alexander Lamfalussy. As Steven Major has been of sufficient quality to perform his duties as Chairman of ESMA over the last five years, it was perfectly logical to extend his mandate to another five-year term.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report because I do not agree with the extension of the term of office of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted to approve the proposal for the extension of the term of office of Steven Maijoor as Chairperson of the ESMA by another five-year term.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. I voted against extending the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA), Mr Steven Maijoor.  Indeed, the latter expressed a very "pro" City position, which led the AEMF, for example, to postpone the application of the EMIR directive by one year, as well as to delay that of MiFID 2, two regulations providing for the restrictions on players in the derivatives markets, which, it should be remembered, are largely responsible for the subprime crisis.

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. \u2012 The Board of Supervisors of the European Financial Instruments and Markets Authority (ESMA) has proposed renewing the term of office of its President for a further five years and has communicated this proposal to the European Parliament. With this report, Mr Gualtieri is complying with the Council's request by referring to Article 48(4) of Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010, according to which the ESMA Board of Supervisors may renew the president's mandate once, subject to confirmation by the European Parliament. I am voting in favour of this position.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. There are no objections to the previous Presidency. I agree with this report.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. The European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) is one of three regulatory institutions created by the European Union following the 2008 financial crisis.  Responsible for harmonising European technical standards and the financial stability of the EU, it is the only authority responsible for rating agencies registered in Europe. But although it identified numerous flaws in the sovereign debt rating process, it imposed only one monetary penalty: a symbolic fine of 30,000 euros against the Canadian agency DBRS, because of its "negligence".  In short, the AEMF does not play the advertised role. Its president, Steven Maijoor, former dean of the School of Business at Maastricht University and former Director General of AFM, the Dutch regulator, has held the post since 2011. He recently said of the Tobin tax on financial transactions: "You have to make rules at 28 or not make them at all", a way of burying the project. It is also responsible for the postponement, to the benefit of the financial sector, of the MiFID II Directive, which is supposed to improve market supervision.  I am voting against the extension of his term as head of the AEMF.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. \u2012 The Board of Supervisors of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) submitted on 24 September 2015 a proposal to extend the term of office of the President of ESMA for another five years.  The European Parliament voted in favour of the proposal and I followed the direction of voting in agreement with the proposal to extend the mandate.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. The 2008 financial crisis demonstrated the many failures of the European financial system. The European Union, in an attempt to strengthen the stability of this sector, has set up the European Securities and Markets Authority in particular. It is a body that assesses investor and market risks and ensures financial stability.  The vote focused on the reappointment of President Steven Maijoor, who has seen his term extended.

name: Miroslav MIKOLÁŠIK
text: Writing. \u2012 Following an open selection procedure, the Council selected the bodies of the first President of the European Securities and Markets Authority in 2011. President Steven Maijoor will be re-elected for a term of five years after the Council of Bodies submitted a proposal to extend it. I agree with the approval of the proposal on the basis of a statement and taking into account the evaluation of the previous term of office. Parliament's decision shall be forwarded to the Council, the Commission, ESMA and the governments of the Member States.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the Gualtieri (A8-0346/2015) report, because I support the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA).

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 The European Securities and Markets Authority was set up by Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010 of the European Parliament and of the Council adopted on 24 November 2010. Its President, Steven Maijoor, was appointed by esma's supervisory board in 2011 after an open tender procedure for a five-year term of office. Under that Regulation, the Board of Supervisors may extend the term of office of the Chairman once, provided that this decision is confirmed by Parliament. The Board of Supervisors decided on 24 September to extend the term of office of the President-in-Office. The Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs heard Steven Maijoor on 17 November and in his report recommended to Parliament that the Decision of the Board of Supervisors be confirmed. I voted accordingly.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. For the AEMF, the ENF Group voted against the reappointment of Steven Maijoor, whose strong pro-financial industry positions have, for example, led the AEMF to delay the implementation of the EMIR directive by one year and to delay miFID II's implementation by one year. While the Commission prepared the text in 2010-11, was adopted in codecision in 2014 and is expected to come into force in 2018, the AEMF is dragging things to Level 2, to the benefit of UK market operators in particular, who fear this regulatory surcharge. The nine-year period for a central market regulation text to come into force illustrates the structural dysfunctions of market regulation, as organised by the European institutions.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 In 2011, the first President of ESMA was appointed by the Board of Supervisors for a term of five years, in accordance with Article 48(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010, and it is possible to extend its term of office for another five years, provided that it is confirmed by the European Parliament in accordance with paragraph 4 of that article. To this extent, the extension of the mandate of the current President of ESMA, Steven Maijoor, was proposed. Consequently, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a successful hearing in which President Steven Maijoor delivered an initial statement, following questions raised by the members of the committee. I am voting in favour of this report, in so far as it complies with the criteria legally required for the extension of the term of office of the President of that institution.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. The extension of the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority, Steven Maijoor, does not seem appropriate. He demonstrated in the course of his duties that he defended the City of London more than the interests of the European peoples.  It was under his mandate that the AEMF postponed the implementation of the EMIR Directive by one year and delayed the implementation of MiFID II. While the Commission prepared the text in 2010-11 for adoption in codecision in 2014, an entry into force in 2018 shows that the AEMF is dragging things out, to the benefit of market operators in London who fear this regulatory overload. That is why I am voting against the extension of Mr Maijoor's mandate.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report which ratifies the ECON Committee’s support the extension of the term of office of Steven Maijoor as Chairperson of the ESMA by another five-year term.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report on extending the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA).  Steven Maijoor, the first president of the AEMF, was appointed in 2011 for a five-year term by the board of the governing authorities, following an open selection process. The Board requested that this term be extended for five years. After a hearing of the current President-in-Office, the European Parliament's Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs approved the request.  I voted in accordance with the opinion of this committee. The mandate of President of this authority can only be renewed once, with the agreement of the European Parliament.

name: József NAGY
text: Writing. \u2012 I would like to thank Mr Steven Maijoort for his work at the head of the European Securities and Markets Authority over the last five years. On the basis of the results of the last term and the hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs on 17 November 2015, I support the extension of his term of office for a further five years.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted the extension of the term of office of the Chairperson of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA).

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I have no doubt that you agree with me that the work done so far by Steven Maijoor as President of ESMA has been excellent. That is why I urge you to vote together in a positive way for its confirmation for the next five years. I would like to take this opportunity, if the outcome of the vote is expected, to wish him well in his work.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. Taking into account all previously submitted reports of ESMA's work so far and expressed superior competences in the performance of the duties of former President Steven Maijoor, I support the report on the extension of the mandate submitted by Roberto Gualtieri. Since its inception on 1 January 2011, ESMA (European Securities and Markets Authority) has focused on contributing to the stability of the Union's financial system, both through ensuring the integrity, efficiency and transparency of the entire orderly operation of financial markets, as well as through increasing investor protection.  It is important to stress that ESMA represents one of the EU's independent bodies, does not take instructions from any other organ, institution or body. The Supervisory Authority and the Management Board represent its main authorities, while at the same time responding to the EU Parliament, where it appears before the ECONA Commission upon request. Steven Maijoor has proven to be a quality president of this body with his academic and professional background and I believe that the extension of the mandate gives continuity in the quality of work.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. The extension of the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority, Steven Maijoor, does not seem appropriate. He demonstrated in the course of his duties that he defended the City of London more than the interests of the European peoples.  It was under his mandate that the AEMF postponed the implementation of the EMIR Directive by one year and delayed the implementation of MiFID II. While the Commission prepared the text in 2010-11 for adoption in codecision in 2014, an entry into force in 2018 shows that the AEMF is dragging things out, to the benefit of market operators in London who fear this regulatory overload.  That is why I am voting against the extension of Mr Maijoor's mandate.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ As 24 September 2015 The ESMA Board of Supervisors proposed extending the mandate of Steven Maijoor, the current president of ESMA, for the next five years on the basis of successful work in the previous term, I support the proposal to extend the mandate of Steven Maijoor as president of ESMA for the next five years.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. - I support fellow MEP Robert Gualtier's report on extending the mandate of the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA).  Given that the first Chair of ESMA was appointed by the Board of Supervisors in 2011 following an open selection procedure for a term of five years in accordance with Article 48(2) of the EEA. Regulation (EU) No 2020/2013 1095/2010, and taking into account that Article 48(4) of the Regulation (EU) No 2020/2013 1095/2010 stipulates that the Board of Supervisors may once extend the term of office of the President of ESMA.  Since the ESMA Board of Supervisors has proposed extending the mandate of Steven Maijoor, the current President of ESMA, for the next five years and informed the European Parliament, I agree to extend the mandate of Steven Maijoor for the next five years.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) oversees financial markets and rating agencies in order to ensure the stability of the EU financial system by working in cooperation with the European Banking Authority (EBA) and the European Insurance and Pensions Authority (EIOPA), in order to build a uniform regulatory system for the European Union's financial markets.  ESMA's steering committee has reconfirmed current chairman Steven Maijoor for a new five-year term. In his role as head of ESMA, Steven Maijoor will continue to lead and plan the work of the committee that heads the organisation, which is composed of representatives of the national supervisory authorities of EU countries.  I wish President Steven Maijoor continued to work to increase and improve investor protection measures and the stability of the Eu ropean Union's financial markets.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. We were asked to vote on the extension of the mandate of the President of the AEMF. It's a common procedure. It is good that Parliament has control over the functioning of the bodies dependent on the institutions.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. Today I voted in favour of the proposal to extend Steven Maijoor's term as President of the European Securities and Markets Authority for a new five-year term.  As a reminder, the European Financial Markets Authority, based in Paris, was created in 2010 to preserve the stability of European financial markets and fill gaps in financial supervision.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. \u2012 We are facing another decision of the European Parliament on the extension of a mandate - in this case, the President of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA), Steven Maijoor - for another five years, pursuant to Article 48(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010. In 2011, Steven Maijoor's selection process for that post followed a completely rigorous and transparent procedure, which is why esma's Board of Supervisors submitted a proposal to extend its mandate, as set out in Article 48(4) of the above-mentioned Regulation. After a successful hearing in the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs and taking into account the positive assessment of the performance of such functions during the first term of office, there are no reasons to justify their non-renewal in office and, to that extent, I voted in favour.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. – Since we oppose the mandate and activity of these three supervisory agencies, we have also opposed the extension of the mandate of their respective presidents.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. I voted against this report because it means increasing the president's mandate to ensure the continuity of the functioning of the European Securities and Markets Authority. We cannot positively sanction the management of this Authority because it is a fundamental part of the European Financial Supervision System and the functioning of stock markets. This system implies a transfer of sovereignty in the field of financial supervision to authorities that lack true democratic control, resulting in financial supervision designed according to the interests of large financial sector companies and, in particular, large market speculators. It is essential to regulate financial supervision to ensure the interests of the European working classes, and Steven Maijoor's current mandate has shown that market regulation is not guaranteed to stop the financial speculation being projected for the Capital Market Union. That is why I have decided to vote against this report.

name: Jill SEYMOUR
text: in writing. ‒ In principle I object to the authority of the EU regulators and so cannot support the extension of the term of office. So I voted against this proposal.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ Steven Maijoor made a good opening statement at the ECON Committee hearing and responded well to the questions from the Members. As ECON approved the extension of the term in office of Mr. Maijoor in his capacity of the Chairperson of the European Securities and Markets Authority earlier this month, this has come to plenary to be voted on.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
