This project of communicative integration of Asia and Europe is an investment of the 21st century, which will bring many benefits to both sides. Central Europe can particularly benefit from this project, and Poland, as a natural place where East and West have been meeting for centuries, can be an excellent logistic base for this project. Nobody today doubts that China is now a world power that plays a key role in the international order. However, this strong position is also associated with responsibility for the fate of the world. Beijing's voice in solving the most important problems should be heard more clearly and support peace-building efforts, especially in the Middle East.

name: Damiano ZOFFOLI
text: in writing.- The issue of relations between our European Union and China is very important;an increasingly important country in a globalized world like ours, with which we must certainly maintain good relations of cooperation and reciprocal exchange.An exchange, however, which must take place through clear and shared rules;I am referring in particular to the granting of market economy status to China, which at the moment may not be possible as Beijing does not comply with most of the trade rules required for the granting of ESM status.I therefore hope for ever greater collaboration between our Union and the Chinese government, in a system of clear and shared rules.

name: Inês Cristina ZUBER
text: in writing.- This report is fraught with hypocritical contradictions because, on the one hand, it is marked by the EU's strong interest in investment and trade issues with China and in its determination to access larger shares of the Chinese domestic market, on the other hand,unacceptable form of interference across the board in China's internal affairs and the arrogance of the right to parameterize a wide range of Chinese policies (from economics to religious politics, from diplomacy to defense, through human rights and civil society).Whether in the section on human rights, whether on issues of security and terrorism or the rights of national minorities, the text strives for supreme hypocrisy, which could be summed up in the expression: "don't look at what I do, do what I preach".It is a roadmap for imposing the EU's vision and interests that we voted against.

name: Seán KELLY
text: – A Uachtaráin, molaim a lán de na rúin atá sa tuarascáil seo agus is maith an rud é go mbeimis ag ullmhú don ollchruinniú seo in Iostanbúl an bhliain seo chugainn agus tá moltaí ann faoi sin.  Ach i ndeireadh na dála, tá an rud céanna le rá agam faoi seo agus a bhí le rá agam ó chianaibh maidir leis an gcáin. Táimid ag cur isteach arís ar chumhachtaí na mBallstát agus ag cur iachall orthu airgead a íoc; agus ní hamháin na Ballstáit ach comhlachtaí agus eagraíochtaí eile. Ní dóigh liom go bhfuil sé sin ceart ach oiread.  Freisin, tá moladh ann faoi ghinmhilleadh a bheith ar fáil go forleathan nuair a bhíonn fonn ann. Nílimid ina fhabhar sin ach oiread. Dá bhrí sin ag deireadh na dála staon mé agus mo chomhghleacaithe sa vóta deiridh.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: - The EU and its Member States have been and continue to be among the most active humanitarian actors in the world for decades, and it is clear that, in the run-up to the World Humanitarian Summit in Istanbul in May 2016, it makes sense to gather information on the EU's role in this regard., to set goals and tasks for further action.Numbers only.Some 250 million people in the world live in humanitarian crises.60 million - forcibly displaced persons.And more than half of all refugees in the world are children.Colleagues, imagine that more than half of the refugees are children.We in the EU cannot stand by.That is why I strongly support this document.

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing.- Conflicts of a political nature, conditions of poverty and natural disasters are just some of the causes that can determine the spread of humanitarian crises.To date, over 250 million people are already victims or at risk of humanitarian crises.Ahead of the first World Humanitarian Summit, which will take place in Istanbul in May 2016, the European Union has clarified its position and objectives.The report emphasizes the necessary respect for the fundamental values of the Union, the establishment of international cooperation and above all the intention to concentrate the humanitarian response on the protection of populations and on the prevention of crisis situations.I voted in favor because I believe that the European Union must be the main actor in guaranteeing a humanitarian response suitable for the prevention and management of crisis situations.

name: Clara AGUILERA
text: written. - Socialists have managed to consolidate a progressive position for the next World Humanitarian Summit (Istanbul, May 2016), we emphasize the key elements to reform the current humanitarian aid system, such as: guaranteeing the defense of humanitarian principles and the impartiality of aid from a political point of view and put mechanisms in place to ensure that governments are accountable for their roles and responsibilities in the area of ​​protecting the most vulnerable. As key measures it is proposed: a global consensus for humanitarian action, greater transparency and accountability regarding the use of aid, a code of conduct for donors and a global fund that ensures and facilitates sufficient means to tackle crises such as Ebola or that of Syrian refugees. We regret that the extremist groups (left and right) of the European Parliament have not supported this report or have abstained, without betting on the protection of the most vulnerable, human dignity and respect for human rights. They have neglected the empowerment of women, the education of children and the protection of migrants and refugees in emergencies.

name: Tim AKER
text: in writing. – UKIP abstained on this non-legislative and non-binding report. UKIP does not recognise the legitimacy of or support the EU acting on behalf of the UK in any international capacity. The report calls for a new fund to be created to which financial contributions would be compulsory. It called for a European action plan and that the private sector align with EU development objectives. However we fully support the calls to end sexual based violence and stop discrimination of the LGBTI community, and that more needs to be done to end human rights abuses. While we cannot support the EU acting in the world, we cannot oppose calls to end abuses around the world – so we have to abstain on this report.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: written. - Although this report can be seen as a call to strengthen and improve humanitarian aid through the support of the World Humanitarian Summit, making positive reference to the need for the EU to be guided by principles of solidarity, responsibility and accountability, these wishes remain in dead paper as long as the EU and its Member States maintain the current trade and foreign policy, which is the cause of many of the conflicts and impoverishment of third countries. This report contains positive aspects such as the need to make a greater effort to guarantee the right to education in humanitarian emergencies, the inclusion of a gender approach in the entire cycle of humanitarian aid and even the recognition of the need minimum humanitarian standards to promote essential public services. But, once again, it once again associates public services with the private sector in a veiled defense of public-private partnerships, thus making it possible for European transnational companies to do business and profit from the vulnerable situation of people in emergency situations. humanitarian. For all this I have abstained.

name: Louis ALIOT
text: in writing. - Faced with the unprecedented increase in the number of conflicts in the world, this report aims to prepare the major themes that will be discussed at the World Humanitarian Summit to be held in May 2016 in Istanbul. Despite a rather promising approach to the new perspectives of humanitarian aid, emphasizing in particular prevention rather than ad hoc management, which is often costly and which does not help the empowerment of the affected countries, this report is in progress. reality polluted by special demands for migrants and separation based on sex. Considering that each state must be able to remain competent in the area of ​​aid financing, any increase and any decision on new measures in humanitarian or development aid should be decided by the sovereign states. I therefore abstained on this text, which unfortunately risks giving rise to binding decisions for States and causing them to lose their competence in the matter. I also believe that humanitarian aid must be able to take place without any discrimination, whatever its basis.

name: Pascal ARIMONT
text: written.- The number of people who depend on humanitarian aid for food to survive has more than doubled since 2004, rising to over 100 million in 2015.Humanitarian crises affect more than 250 million victims.It is high time to find a global, comprehensive and long-term solution to the mass flows of people fleeing war.The role and credibility of Europe on the global humanitarian scene is also at stake.That is why I supported the European Parliament's motion for a resolution on the preparation of the world summit on humanitarian aid.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: in writing.- The multiplication of conflicts in the world inevitably leads to the displacement of populations which causes serious humanitarian problems.It is in this context that the humanitarian summit will be held on May 23 and 24 in Istanbul.This report aims to prepare the themes addressed on this occasion.This underlines the importance for Member States to increase their funding for humanitarian aid and proposes to make more flexible the methods by which this aid is delivered.It further emphasizes access to international humanitarian law everywhere, regardless of the crisis and calls for special attention for children, women and people with disabilities.Even though the report insists on the importance of prevention rather than management after the fact, a set of communitarian claims parasitizes its interest.I therefore chose to abstain.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ Whilst of course I agree with much of the content of this report, once again this covers on an area which should be the Member States’ responsibility.  The United Kingdom should speak for itself, and it is not for the Commission to tell us what to say.   I therefore abstained on the report.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this proposal in preparation for the World Humanitarian Summit.Due to the ongoing needs related to these conflicts and disasters, the humanitarian response system has reached its limits.Given that the gap between humanitarian needs and operational and financial means to meet them may continue to widen, UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has called for the first-ever World Humanitarian Summit (WHS).I agree that the EU has the potential to play a leading role.It is vital that the EU should travel to Istanbul with common positions and speak with one voice in order to influence the negotiations on the final document.It is important for the EU to emphasize the key role of NGOs in the field of humanitarian action and to ensure that their views are taken into account throughout the process.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: in writing.- Despite a rather promising approach to the new perspectives of humanitarian aid, emphasizing in particular prevention rather than ad hoc management, which is often costly and which does not help the empowerment of affected countries, this report isin reality also perverted by gender theory and a globalist vision refocused on the myth of the migrant.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: in writing.- More than 250 million people are today affected by humanitarian crises and nearly 60 million people are displaced, half of them children.Faced with this alarming observation, Parliament calls for the World Humanitarian Summit to define concrete commitments and be based on an impartial conception of aid and on principles such as humanity, neutrality and independence of aid.humanitarian.Humanitarian issues require people-centered and human rights-based protection measures.The resolution, which I approved, also calls for a comprehensive, lasting and world-class solution to the mass exodus of refugees from conflict zones, reminding us of Europe's role and credibility on the global humanitarian scene..

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: written. - We have ABSTAINED in voting on the report on the World Humanitarian Summit because, despite including positive references, such as gender and migrant rights, in line with the current trend in the privatization cooperation / aid system , the report calls for a strong push for the inclusion of the private sector in humanitarian action. Thus, the report calls for aligning action strategies with business objectives. The report also calls for an increase in public-private partnerships in humanitarian action; partnerships that have proven to be ineffective and that often result in privatization of benefits and socialization of risks and losses. We consider that the policy of humanitarian action has to be a purely public policy and not be at the service of private interests; Only in this way can we equip ourselves with a robust humanitarian policy capable of meeting the challenges we face.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: written.- I have supported this report because it introduces proposals and contributions of interest to improve the international system of humanitarian assistance by creating, for example, a global fund and reforming some concepts that are now essential to face some of the most serious humanitarian crises, such as that of theimmigrants.It is essential to recognize the role of host countries and incorporate causes into the definition of forcibly displaced persons.We also find it appropriate to expressly mention groups that suffer double victimization in humanitarian crises, such as the disabled, women, minors or LGBTI-type groups.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: in writing. - This report on the preparation of the World Humanitarian Summit aims to prepare the main themes that will be addressed at the World Humanitarian Summit in May 2016 in Istanbul. Faced with the unprecedented increase in the number of conflicts in the world, which has led to the displacement of a significant number of people, this summit must set up a single, coordinated and more transparent international humanitarian structure. This report proposes in particular the need for Member States to increase their funding for humanitarian aid, the establishment of more flexible methods for the delivery of aid and finally the guarantee of access to international humanitarian law. worldwide. Despite a rather promising approach, this report is in reality polluted by claims that have no direct link with our subject, in particular through two opinions from the FEMM and AFET commission (sex education, LGBT claims, migrants' rights) . I therefore abstained on this report.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing.- The Guerrero Salom report, which analyzes the preparations for the world humanitarian summit to be held in Istanbul next May, appears to be partly an acceptable text, unfortunately there are some gray areas of no small importance that could give rise to critical issues: an estimate of the amount of future possible EU funding is not specified, it is not specified who could be the beneficiary countries or their intended use.For these reasons I expressed myself with an abstention.

name: Malin BJÖRK
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report.The report welcomes the decision of the UN Secretary - General to convene a first world summit on humanitarian issues.There are many good writings, includingfor equality and against violence against women, as well as guarantees that women and girls will have access to sexual and reproductive health, including the possibility of safe abortion, in connection with humanitarian crises.Although I voted in favor of the report as a whole, I do not support the writings that seek to expand the opportunities for business and the private sector in development cooperation and make it a key player in achieving the new development goals.That is not the way forward.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: written. - The humanitarian aid system does not face challenges such as the Ebola crisis, Syria, Yemen or Iraq. We are verifying this with the current migration crisis in Europe. Thus, a new process is launched to adapt and improve the effectiveness of humanitarian action. The first World Humanitarian Summit will take place in Istanbul on May 23 and 24, 2016. This report reflects the main concerns of a sector threatened by the unprecedented increase in conflicts and disasters, due to lack of means, access and protection. Likewise, the Council is urged to ensure a firm common position so that our voice is heard globally and we are not only recognized as one of the largest donors, but also as a body that assumes responsibilities and leads by example. The report proposes three lines of joint global action: a global consensus for humanitarian action, a code of conduct for donors and a global fund for humanitarian action. All this to reaffirm respect for international humanitarian law, protection, independence of aid and the need to adapt the humanitarian response system to local needs.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report because it sets out Parliament's position in the run-up to the World Humanitarian Summit and assesses the challenges and opportunities for humanitarian aid. Due to growing challenges such as urbanization and rapid population growth, demographic change, the prevalence and intensity of natural disasters, the environmental situation, deterioration, desertification, climate change, various long-standing and simultaneous conflicts affecting the region, resource scarcity, as well as poverty, inequality, migration, displacement and instability, have greatly increased the need for a humanitarian response worldwide. Parliament therefore warmly welcomed the UN's decision to convene the first Multilateral World Stakeholders' Summit and Turkey's readiness to convene it. It also called on the Member States to support the World Humanitarian Summit and on the Council to draw firm conclusions with concrete commitments and priority areas for action, while pursuing operational efficiency, common quality standards, better coordination and partnership with new donors, based on a political approach. impartial assistance and a common understanding of and compliance with the humanitarian principles of humanity, neutrality, impartiality and independence, and the fulfillment of obligations under international humanitarian law.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: in writing. - Currently, the world has to deal with an unprecedented amount of humanitarian crisis. The length and severity of these crises are also unprecedented. As a result, there are now more refugees and internally displaced persons than after World War II. In May 2016, at the initiative of UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon, the first humanitarian summit will be held in Istanbul to transform the current humanitarian system, making it more efficient and adapting to new challenges. The report seeks to provide clear guidelines for this, in particular with regard to food security, population growth and climate change. In addition to reducing vulnerability and managing risk, the report places great emphasis on transforming through innovation and making funding more transparent. The report calls for the adoption of a five-year roadmap as the final document of the conference, which includes political commitments in the field of development.

name: Renata BRIANO
text: in writing. - The European Union is a world leader in humanitarian aid both with the commitment of its men and means, and with the financial contribution. In the last ten years, however, there has been a gradual reduction in the protection of humanitarian workers and the health facilities they activate in emergency theaters: neutrality, inviolability and international protection of operators and health facilities (as well as hospitalized in them) have not been respected. There are numerous cases of structures that have become targets of military actions even with the use of weapons of mass destruction. The EU needs to rethink its intervention strategy in the systemic challenges of the current aid architecture. There is a clear need to move from a culture of reaction to that of forecasting: more needs to be done to prevent crises, including the possibility of their recurrence, and more attention is needed on issues such as adjustment and resilience, in particular bridging the gap between humanitarian action and long-term development. The EU should rely on the European consensus on humanitarian aid - as Europe's shared and ethical approach - to guide its input into the international humanitarian aid support process and also use it as a regional model to be actively promoted.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: in writing. - Next May, the world humanitarian summit will be held in Istanbul, from which a unique international humanitarian structure will emerge that is much more transparent than the previous one. It is in this context that this report prepares the main themes to be addressed. Faced with the migration of millions of people around the world due to the increase in the number of conflicts, this report recommends increasing the contribution of Member States to humanitarian aid with the sole aim of guaranteeing protection. of these populations, in particular children, women and the disabled. Despite an interesting approach to the new perspectives of humanitarian aid, this report incorporates claims that are unrelated to the subject. The rapporteur also takes the opportunity to ask the national authorities to increase funding for infrastructure intended for the reception of illegal migrants and invites them to welcome as many as possible. This is the reason why I abstained on this text.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: signed up.- Currently, 250 million people are affected by humanitarian crises and more than 60 million people are forcibly displaced.These are figures that cannot leave us impassive and that demand more and more humanitarian answers from all over the world.Given that by 2050, one billion people are likely to be displaced as a result of climate change, joint action is needed and trust needs to be strengthened, as well as expanded cooperation between private sector groups, NGOs., local authorities, international organizations and governments.I am in favor of this report because, as a major global donor and key player in the humanitarian field, the EU has a responsibility to take a leading role in exploiting more efficient and effective means tomeet the needs of people affected by conflict and disaster.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing.- I cast an abstention vote because the report does not clearly specify: whether and how much future possible EU funding is;who are the beneficiaries;how these funds will be used and how and by whom their use will be monitored.

name: Cristian-Silviu BUŞOI
text: signed up. - Globally, there is a growing need for humanitarian responses to the challenges posed by rapid population growth, demographic change, urbanization, increasing natural disasters and their severity, environmental degradation, desertification, climate change, long-term conflicts and simultaneous conflicts with regional impact, as well as resource scarcity, coupled with the consequences of poverty, migration, inequality, forced displacement and vulnerability. The number of people in need has more than doubled since 2004, reaching more than 100 million in 2015, and 250 million people are affected by humanitarian crises, while the number of people forcibly displaced has reached almost 60 million. people, 40 million of whom are internally displaced, and more than 50% of refugees worldwide are children. I support the EP's motion for a resolution on the preparation of the World Summit on Humanitarian Aid (WHS). WHS, first convened by the UN Secretary-General, will take place in Istanbul in May 2016. I consider it imperative to ensure a closer link between the humanitarian and development sectors and to refocus attention on prevention and anticipation measures, changing the current approach, based on the humanitarian response.

name: Alain CADEC
text: in writing.- The first World Humanitarian Summit will take place on May 23-24, 2016 in Istanbul, Turkey.It will then be an opportunity to rethink humanitarian aid in the light of the events of recent years which have engendered unprecedented humanitarian consequences.Indeed, the number, scale and duration of the current humanitarian crises have doubled the number of people in need since 2014. The number of forcibly displaced people has also increased considerably.Humanitarian aid must therefore be restructured so that it becomes more effective and genuinely responds to current challenges.The European Union must be a leader in this matter.The humanitarian aid that the Union provides to third countries is important.The latter must therefore ensure the proper management of this aid.I voted in favor of this resolution.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing.- Today I voted in favor of the report on preparations for the World Humanitarian Summit.The number of people in need has more than doubled since 2004, exceeding 100 million in 2015. As highlighted by the report, the EU and Member States must take the lead by providing an active example to ensure both physical and psychological protection forvulnerable people.At the next World Humanitarian Summit, a comprehensive, comprehensive and long-term solution needs to be found for people fleeing the conflict regions en masse.The European Union must have a leading role in this regard.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. – While, there were many positive provisions contained within this report, I was unable to vote in favour of this report. The dossier called for further involvement of the private sector, businesses and public-private partnerships in disaster management, humanitarian action and national emergency plans. It is patently obvious that the private sector should have no such involvement and that any such involvement would serve only to commercialise humanitarian crises to the detriment of those who have been adversely affected.  Positive aspects of the report included calling for matters such as population increase, urbanisation, climate change, gender equality and migration to be taken into account in humanitarian action. Moreover, international commitment to reach the target of 0.7% ODA/GNI, and reducing the militaristic tone of the draft report were reflected in the compromises, which was welcome. However, due to the calling for involvement of the private sector, I had no choice but to abstain on this report.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. – UKIP abstained on this non-legislative and non-binding report. UKIP does not recognise the legitimacy of or support the EU acting on behalf of the UK in any international capacity. The report calls for a new fund to be created to which financial contributions would be compulsory. It called for a European action plan and that the private sector align with EU development objectives. However we fully support the calls to end sexual based violence and stop discrimination of the LGBTI community, and that more needs to be done to end human rights abuses. While we cannot support the EU acting in the world, we cannot oppose calls to end abuses around the world – so we have to abstain on this report.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ We are currently facing a growing number of humanitarian challenges and they continually put the international system to the test in providing the necessary assistance. I agree that the Summit presents a unique opportunity to work together to ensure a principled and effective humanitarian action. On the other hand I was unable to vote in favour of this report as it included references to abortion and sexual and reproductive health and rights with which I disagree.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing.- The World Humanitarian Summit, which will take place in Istanbul in May 2016, aims to adapt the humanitarian system to the current rapidly evolving emergency scenario in order to make humanitarian action more efficient and effective, ultimately movingemphasis from reaction to prevention and prediction.The EU is the main donor in the field of humanitarian action and the report aims to equip it with the tools to take on a leadership role, sharing the good practices it has already been a protagonist of.The report, which limits the role of the private sector and military forces in interventions, is certainly a positive one and I have therefore voted in favor of it.

name: Caterina CHINNICI
text: in writing. - The Summit next May must not find Europe unprepared: the commitment made for months to face the increase in migratory flows has allowed us to develop some best practices that can become a model for the management of humanitarian emergencies. The needs are multiple: to provide food, shelter, livelihoods, medical care, practical assistance and psychological support. All this while ensuring, in all circumstances, full respect for dignity and fundamental rights, and avoiding any unjustified inequality of treatment based on ethnicity, religion, culture or nationality. However, we ask for a further step, that is to ensure, among other things, adequate education for minors in emergency situations, through measures such as, for example, the creation of "educational corridors" for students from conflict zones. . We must ensure that, as foreseen by the New York Convention, education is always guaranteed, also as a key element to allow the full enjoyment of all civil, social, economic, cultural and political rights in every part of the world. I therefore strongly support, in particular, the European Commission's proposal to allocate 4% of the European fund for humanitarian aid to these purposes. For these reasons, I voted in favor.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: PPE), in writing. - We support the report and agree that the unprecedented great needs and limited resources are testing the limits of the global humanitarian response system. At the same time, the basic concepts of dignity, humanity and solidarity are at stake. The EU is expected, and can expect, to take the lead in WHS processes for a strong humanitarian and outcome-oriented outcome. In order to successfully influence the negotiations on the final text and the follow-up to the summit, the EU must express focused common positions in Istanbul and show unity. It must use the European common concept of humanitarian aid to guide its contribution and promote it as a model for a global concept. The EU must also continue to emphasize the essential role of NGOs in humanitarian action and ensure that their views are taken into account in the processes and in the outcome.

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: GUE / NGL), in writing.- The report on the preparation for the World Humanitarian Summit raises a number of issues related to the goals we want to set in the long run, for the development of our society.Although as a whole it is a positive effort, in practice it contains elements that promote private interests and for this reason I decided to abstain.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ The world is being faced with humanitarian crises unprecedented both in their number, scale and persistence. The number of people in need has more than doubled since 2004 to over 100 million in 2015. 250 million people are affected by humanitarian crises and the number of forcibly displaced persons has reached its highest point since World War II at nearly 60 million and over half of the world’s refugees are children. This own-initiative report aims to give clear inputs to the first World Humanitarian Summit (WHS) to be held in Istanbul from 23 to 24 May 2016.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. - The latest global discussions on the framework for humanitarian action took place almost twenty-five years ago. Since then, the conditions of humanitarian assistance have changed significantly, with a steady increase in the number, size and persistence of humanitarian emergencies resulting from both man-made conflicts and natural disasters and aggravated by issues of global impact, such as climate change. I support the Salom Report as it considers it important that global players, and especially the EU, as the main donor, should play a major role in the remodeling of humanitarian architecture to make it more inclusive, effective, transparent and responsive to increased humanitarian needs related to current challenges such as the wave of displacement of people. I believe that in the framework of the summit, the EU should build on the European Consensus on Humanitarian Aid to guide its contribution to the process and use it as a regional model to be promoted. Finally, given the nature of current emergency situations, new financing is urgent, and Parliament has already stressed the importance of maintaining equal payment and authorization appropriations in the Humanitarian Aid chapter and in the emergency aid reserve.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. - I agree with the decision of the UN Secretary-General to convene the first multi-stakeholder World Humanitarian Summit (VUM) to be hosted in Turkey, as I firmly believe that the enormous humanitarian challenges of today require the development of a new, more inclusive humanitarian system, different and truly global. The European Union must foster a global consensus on humanitarian action, reaffirming the principles of humanitarian aid, ensuring people-centered and human rights-based protection responses: upholding key humanitarian principles and continuing commitment to humanitarian aid. themselves are fundamental to guaranteeing a humanitarian space in areas affected by conflicts and natural disasters. In this regard, I argue that greater complementarity is needed between humanitarian aid and development aid in order to strengthen effectiveness and fill financial gaps in the humanitarian sector. This should be accompanied by increased funding for both categories of aid.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. – I agree with the provision of humanitarian aid in line with international humanitarian law and also share the concerns over, and condemn, the continued use of rape and other forms of sexual and gender-based violence against women and girls as a war weapon in humanitarian emergencies; but I feel that ensuring that women and girls access to ‘safe abortion’ as part of a full range of sexual and reproductive health is a step too far which surpasses the EU’s parameters of legal jurisdiction.

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing.- Ban Ki-moon has convened in Istanbul, for 23 and 24 May 2016, the first "world humanitarian summit" in history, which will bring together governments, United Nations agencies (including the Red Cross), private operators andrepresentatives of the populations, with the aim of identifying new approaches to deal with crisis situations.In anticipation of the summit, the European Commission has prepared a document expressing its position, prompting the international community to reflect on the importance of conflict prevention, which must be at the basis of humanitarian aid from all governments.In addition to some divisions that emerged between the various groups, I believe that the work done in anticipation of the humanitarian summit is good with regard to the protection of rights in humanitarian emergency situations.That is why my vote on the report is in favor.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: written. - Although this report can be seen as a call to strengthen and improve humanitarian aid through the support of the World Humanitarian Summit, making positive reference to the need for the EU to be guided by principles of solidarity, responsibility and accountability, these wishes remain in dead paper as long as the EU and its Member States maintain the current trade and foreign policy, which is the cause of many of the conflicts and impoverishment of third countries. This report contains positive aspects such as the need to make a greater effort to guarantee the right to education in humanitarian emergencies, the inclusion of a gender approach in the entire cycle of humanitarian aid and even the recognition of the need minimum humanitarian standards to promote essential public services. But, once again, it once again associates public services with the private sector in a veiled defense of public-private partnerships, thus making it possible for European transnational companies to do business and profit from the vulnerable situation of people in emergency situations. humanitarian. For all this I have abstained.

name: Andi CRISTEA
text: signed up. - The European Union and its Member States, as the main donors of humanitarian aid, are key actors in policy-making with worldwide operational experience. The humanitarian system must meet the challenge of providing increased support to as many people as possible and at higher costs. Given the scale of the current crises and disasters, funding for humanitarian aid is insufficient, despite the very high level of donor contributions. In addition to the financial resource, there is a need to consider changing the way the humanitarian community acts in terms of planning, coordination and response capacity. The humanitarian aid summit must find the best ways to protect the civilian population, identify threats and monitor violations of human rights and international humanitarian law. A major importance in humanitarian aid is the need to provide food, water, shelter, hygiene and medical treatment to those in need, ie minimum humanitarian standards must be ensured, which must be maintained during the intervention. It must also not be ignored, but, on the contrary, the right to education must be promoted and supported during long humanitarian crises, failing which the future of children is threatened.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report which is Parliament’s opinion on the global humanitarian situation and ways the EU can help assist in order to overcome global obstacles. This report comes shortly before the first ever World Humanitarian Summit and serves as Parliament’s communication before this summit is held in Istanbul this year. Parliament’s communication focuses on various aspects of humanitarian aid taking into account the developments all over the world – in broad terms of security, poverty and famine, conflict and natural disasters. Amongst other things, the report advocates to ensure extra efforts are made so that children in these regions affected by situations have full access to education – an aspect that is often overlooked in humanitarian policy.  As is my policy line, I voted against reference to abortive measures as a solution. However, given that sexual reproductive health services include a wide range of services which can assist women to have healthy pregnancies and deliveries of their children in a safe and well informed environment I felt the need to vote in favour of such services in these situations to ensure that everyone is given a decent shot at life thanks to a safe delivery.

name: Viorica DĂNCILĂ
text: signed up.- I fully support the rapporteur's position that the European Union, as a major donor and a key global player in the humanitarian field, can generate the necessary leverage and also has a responsibility to take a leading role inexploring more effective and efficient means of meeting the needs of people affected by conflict and disaster.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: in writing.- This own-initiative report proposes the European Parliament's contribution in view of the world humanitarian summit to be held on 23 and 24 May 2016 in Istanbul.Due to an increase in humanitarian crises around the world, the number of people in need has more than doubled since 2004, rising to 100 million people in 2015, knowing that more than half of the world's refugees are children.The rapporteur asks to include in the final document of the humanitarian summit "a five-year roadmap for the development and the implementation of the concrete political commitments which have been subscribed".It also highlights the importance of strengthening the complementarity between humanitarian aid and development aid, in order to deal with funding gaps.Considering that it is balanced, I supported this report.

name: Rachida DATI
text: in writing.- I supported this report presenting the EU's contributions towards the World Humanitarian Summit in order to make humanitarian aid more open, more efficient and more transparent.This report rightly emphasizes the adoption and implementation of preventive measures and concrete operational guidelines in the management of humanitarian crises.

name: Angélique DELAHAYE
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the Guerrero Salom report on the preparation of the world humanitarian summit.Through this resolution, I call on the European Union to put protection at the heart of its humanitarian action in order to meet the needs of every citizen.Likewise, I wanted to emphasize the central role of women in conflict and post-conflict situations, which is why it is essential to incorporate equality between men and women in humanitarian programming.Finally, I welcome the establishment of a global alliance for humanitarian innovation which will enable the improvement of existing programs.

name: Andor DELI
text: in writing. - Currently, the world has to deal with an unprecedented amount of humanitarian crisis. The length and severity of these crises are also unprecedented. As a result, there are now more refugees and internally displaced persons than after World War II. In May 2016, at the initiative of UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon, the first humanitarian summit will be held in Istanbul to transform the current humanitarian system, making it more efficient and adapting to new challenges. The report seeks to provide clear guidelines for this, especially with regard to food security, population growth and climate change. In addition to reducing vulnerability and managing risk, the report places great emphasis on transforming through innovation and making funding more transparent. The report calls for the adoption of a five-year roadmap as the final document of the conference, which includes political commitments in the field of development.

name: Gérard DEPREZ
text: in writing. - I supported this report because it is alarming that the number of people in need has more than doubled since 2004 to exceed 100 million people in 2015. 250 million people are affected by humanitarian crises. The number of internally displaced people reached its highest level since World War II with nearly 60 million internally displaced people worldwide. More than half of the world's refugees are children. One billion human beings could be displaced by climate change by 2050. Faced with this, it is urgent to take action. I therefore support the request addressed to the Member States to support the World Humanitarian Summit and to adopt proactive conclusions defining priority commitments based on a politically impartial conception of humanitarian aid. I give special support for a comprehensive, lasting and global solution to the mass exodus of refugees from conflict zones. Europe's role and credibility on the global humanitarian scene are at stake in the Union's response to the current crisis.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: in writing. - The main objective of this report was to prepare the main themes of the meeting of the world humanitarian summit scheduled for Istanbul on 23 and 24 May. While the number of internally displaced persons and conflicts is particularly worrying today given the multiple wars resulting from the Arab Spring, the humanitarian aid community must find more effective and realistic ways to deal with the increase in aid needs. of all types in the world. Underlining the importance of granting funding up to the current challenges, and of relying on local intermediaries, this report is a step in the right direction. However, many ideological proposals have nothing to do with the concerns raised. Thus, education in relational and sexual life is regrettably put on the same level as the delivery of water in a country at war. I therefore voted against this report, which clearly does not identify the right priorities for humanitarian aid.

name: Angel DZHAMBAZKI
text: In written form. - The report presented to us by my colleague Enrique Guerrero Salom is significant in volume and tries to give direction in resolving a difficult issue - that of humanitarian activity as a reaction against the suffering of people caused by natural events and human activity. It is worth noting here that the EU is one of the largest donors of humanitarian aid in the world, with a number of European countries (Member States) also, apart from the Union's instruments, providing a considerable amount of humanitarian aid. In this regard, I would like to point out that we are fulfilling our public duty as states, but we cannot solve the global humanitarian crises alone. Moreover, here in Europe, too, there are humanitarian crises right next to our borders. In countries like mine, there are people living in Bulgaria who need humanitarian aid to survive. Yes, it sounds too much, to some it is exaggerated, but it is true.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. - The humanitarian crisis is basically created and aggravated by the policies of the great powers that aim mainly at strengthening their roles on the world chessboard. Economic interests, the pursuit of wealth and the increase of their geopolitical and geostrategic position are the main cause of conflicts, crises and wars but also the deterioration of the state of the environment. It is necessary to provide well-structured, coordinated and effective humanitarian aid from all countries and from international bodies and organizations. However, any approach to the issue of humanitarian aid must be made with special attention to the specifics of each region and with respect for the cultural values ​​and culture of the respective population groups. The involvement of the private sector in humanitarian aid and humanitarian crisis management must be ancillary and not driven by the profitability of the respective companies to the detriment of the objectives pursued.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: in writing. - Currently, the world has to deal with an unprecedented amount of humanitarian crisis. The length and severity of these crises are also unprecedented. As a result, there are now more refugees and internally displaced persons than after World War II. In May 2016, at the initiative of UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon, the first humanitarian summit will be held in Istanbul to transform the current humanitarian system, making it more efficient and adapting to new challenges. The report seeks to provide clear guidelines for this, especially with regard to food security, population growth and climate change. In addition to reducing vulnerability and managing risk, the report places great emphasis on transforming through innovation and making funding more transparent. The report calls for the adoption of a five-year roadmap as the final document of the conference, which includes political commitments in the field of development.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: in writing.- I abstained on this report because it includes too many "jumpers" unrelated to the initial subject.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. - This report is about the World Humanitarian Summit (CHM) and aims to contribute to a common EU position at this summit. It is said that the objectives of the CHM will be to reformulate the humanitarian system and adapt it to a rapidly evolving emergency scenario, in order to make humanitarian action more efficient and prepared. There is a call for greater rapprochement between communities dedicated to humanitarian assistance and for deviating the focus of action from the response to prevention and anticipation. The world faces unprecedented humanitarian crises, both in number and scale and persistence. 2014 witnessed the dramatic increase in forced displacement caused by wars and conflicts, registering the highest level in recent history. Most of these situations are a painful demonstration of the inhuman, exploitative and aggressive character of the capitalist system and have causes and those responsible: the destabilization processes in various parts of the globe and the imperialist wars of aggression, the policy of economic domination and the plundering of resources natural. The report calls on Member States to integrate the business into their national emergency plans and advocates strengthening cooperation with the private sector in humanitarian actions. A vision that we do not share, so we did not vote in favor.

name: Luke Ming FLANAGAN
text: in writing. – I abstained because I believe the EU creates many of these same humanitarian problems in the first place.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing. - Following the recent events, there is no doubt that the world is facing an unprecedented humanitarian crisis in numbers, scale and perseverance. Although there has been a significant increase in funding recently, humanitarian aid needs are growing much faster. In the future, security risks may increase as more and more perceptions of humanitarian aid as a tool used for political or economic reasons are expanding. The European Union, as a leading donor and a key global player in humanitarian action, must take the lead in seeking more efficient and effective ways to meet the needs of people affected by conflict and disaster. Next year's World Summit on Humanitarian Aid should therefore focus on the special protection of women, children of people with disabilities. Specific protection should be provided to children, in particular to facilitate their access to education during emergencies. We must work together to increase the involvement and cooperation of the private sector, non-governmental organizations, local authorities and international organizations in humanitarian action and to build partnerships with non-traditional donors. The European Union must take the lead and play a key role in the WHS process, towards achieving a strong result.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing.- Too general a report, such a delicate issue cannot be addressed in this way.The beneficiaries are not specified, how these funds will be used and how and by whom their use will be monitored.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. - The humanitarian crisis is basically created and aggravated by the policies of the great powers, which aim mainly at strengthening their roles on the world chessboard. Economic interests, the pursuit of wealth and the strengthening of their geopolitical and geostrategic position are the main cause of conflicts, crises and wars but also the degradation of the environment. It is essential to provide well-structured, coordinated and effective humanitarian assistance from all countries, international bodies and organizations. However, any approach to the provision of humanitarian aid must be made with particular attention to the specifics of each region and with respect for the cultural values ​​and culture of the respective population groups. The involvement of the private sector in humanitarian aid and humanitarian crisis management must be ancillary and not driven by the profitability of the respective companies to the detriment of the objectives pursued. For the above reasons, I am voting against this report.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ I strongly believe that the EU should assume leadership and play a pivotal role in the World Humanitarian Summit process, towards a strong outcome. The EU should consider the World Humanitarian Summit as an opportunity to build partnerships and find common ground on humanitarian principles and international standards, and to enhance cooperation and coordination of assistance.  More cooperation and complementary is needed between humanitarian and development policies, which should go hand in hand with increased development aid and humanitarian funding. Moreover, special protection has to be given to women, children and people with disabilities. Specific protection should be provided to children and notably to the facilitation of their access to education during emergencies. I support more involvement and cooperation of the private sector, NGOs, local authorities and international organisations in humanitarian actions and the building of partnerships with non-traditional donors.

name: Mariya GABRIEL
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the report on the preparation of the World Humanitarian Summit because it is a first, on the initiative of the Secretary General of the United Nations, and because the European Union and its Member States, as that first donor must prepare and ensure a major influence on the conclusions of this summit. I welcome the request to include in the final document of the world humanitarian summit a five-year roadmap for the development and the implementation of the concrete political commitments that will have been made. I also welcome the emphasis placed on coordination between EU and international policies and instruments, on the close link between humanitarian aid and development, as well as on international justice. Nevertheless, I regret that the report does not offer a more in-depth reflection on the application of international humanitarian law in the context of humanitarian crises such as those linked to terrorist groups, as well as a reflection on an adapted status for displaced persons. the effects of climate change.

name: Kinga GÁL
text: in writing. - Currently, the world has to deal with an unprecedented amount of humanitarian crisis. The length and severity of these crises are also unprecedented. As a result, there are now more refugees and internally displaced persons than after World War II. In May 2016, at the initiative of UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon, the first humanitarian summit will be held in Istanbul to transform the current humanitarian system, making it more efficient and adapting to new challenges. The report seeks to provide clear guidelines for this, especially with regard to food security, population growth and climate change. In addition to reducing vulnerability and managing risk, the report places great emphasis on transforming through innovation and making funding more transparent. The report calls for the adoption of a five-year roadmap as the final document of the conference, which includes political commitments in the field of development.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: written.- I voted in favor given the realization that we are experiencing a series of unprecedented humanitarian crises to which we must give the appropriate response.The World Humanitarian Summit will take place in Istanbul in May 2016, with the objective of reconfiguring the humanitarian system and adapting it to a rapidly evolving emergency landscape, in order to make humanitarian action more efficient, effective and appropriate.The EU, as the main donor and key global actor, has a responsibility to drive the search for more efficient and effective forms of humanitarian aid.

name: Eider GARDIAZABAL RUBIAL
text: written. - Socialists have managed to consolidate a progressive position for the next World Humanitarian Summit (Istanbul, May 2016), we emphasize the key elements to reform the current humanitarian aid system, such as: guaranteeing the defense of humanitarian principles and the impartiality of aid from a political point of view and put mechanisms in place to ensure that governments are accountable for their roles and responsibilities in the area of ​​protecting the most vulnerable. As key measures it is proposed: a global consensus for humanitarian action, greater transparency and accountability regarding the use of aid, a code of conduct for donors and a global fund that ensures and facilitates sufficient means to tackle crises such as Ebola or that of Syrian refugees. We regret that the extremist groups (left and right) of the European Parliament have not supported this report or have abstained, without betting on the protection of the most vulnerable, human dignity and respect for human rights. They have neglected the empowerment of women, the education of children and the protection of migrants and refugees in emergencies.

name: Elisabetta GARDINI
text: in writing.- The year that is closing has once again confronted us with dramatic humanitarian emergencies around the world.Those in the countries close to Europe in particular have touched us closely, generating an unprecedented migration phenomenon.Today more than ever, therefore, we must multiply our efforts to offer humanitarian assistance locally to populations in difficulty.Among these, I would like to mention in particular all the persecuted Christian populations, too often forgotten.

name: Elena GENTILE
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the EP resolution on Preparations for the World Humanitarian Summit: Challenges and Opportunities of Humanitarian Assistance because I believe that our world is increasingly vulnerable due to the diversity and intensity of famines, natural disasters, epidemics and conflicts spread across multiple areas of the planet. Humanitarian assistance today has to face ever greater challenges and difficulties, not only due to the disproportion between the costs of assistance and the reduction in available budgets, but also due to the threats and armed attacks against humanitarian workers which represent a violation of the law I therefore share the need to build a more inclusive and truly global humanitarian system, capable of providing an effective and efficient response to major global crises, of protecting the fundamental rights and safety of personnel and assisted persons and of support the improvement of dialogue between actors at all levels. Finally, I share the invitation to the EU, which continues to represent the main donor of humanitarian aid, to assume a leadership role in the first UN Humanitarian Summit (VUM) in Turkey and to promote an agreement global that identifies precise priorities and methods of humanitarian intervention.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report on the preparation of the World Summit on Humanitarian Aid: Challenges and Opportunities for Humanitarian Aid, as I think such a summit would be useful.The task is to found a new cultura caritatis for our world.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: written.- It is important that the World Summit on Humanitarian Aid is properly prepared.The global community is currently confronted with humanitarian crises the dimensions of which far exceed past crises.That is why it is particularly important now that solution concepts are developed on an international level.What we need is a roadmap that will last for years to come.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the report on preparing for the World Humanitarian Summit given it is crucial we have a clear view on challenges and opportunities in this field in the run-up to the Istanbul summit. Given the significant number of grave humanitarian crises around the world, including in Syria, Iraq, Yemen, and many countries in Sub-Sahara Africa, it is of paramount importance that the EU, as the world’s most important humanitarian actor, takes the lead during the summit to build partnerships and find common ground on humanitarian principles and international standards, and to enhance cooperation and coordination of assistance.  Key action points should include better protection for humanitarian aid workers, more cooperation and complementarity between humanitarian and development policies, and finding new sources for funding. The absolute priority should be the protection of children and their access to education. I therefore welcome that this report calls for specific protection to be provided to children who have fled their homes in a crisis, and notably to the facilitation of their access to education.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: written. - We have ABSTAINED in voting on the report on the World Humanitarian Summit because, despite including positive references, such as gender and migrant rights, in line with the current trend in the privatization cooperation / aid system , the report calls for a strong push for the inclusion of the private sector in humanitarian action. Thus, the report calls for aligning action strategies with business objectives. The report also calls for an increase in public-private partnerships in humanitarian action; partnerships that have proven to be ineffective and that often result in privatization of benefits and socialization of risks and losses. We consider that the policy of humanitarian action has to be a purely public policy and not be at the service of private interests; Only in this way can we equip ourselves with a robust humanitarian policy capable of meeting the challenges we face.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report as it encourages the EU to assume leadership and play an important role in the World Humanitarian Summit (WHS) process. I would also encourage the UK Government to join the EU in taking a lead in humanitarian action, and to consider building partnerships and find common ground on humanitarian principles and international standards, through the opportunities presented through the WHS.

name: Nathan GILL
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP abstained on this non-legislative and non-binding report. UKIP does not recognise the legitimacy of or support the EU acting on behalf of the UK in any international capacity. The report calls for a new fund to be created to which financial contributions would be compulsory. It called for a European action plan and that the private sector align with EU development objectives. However we fully support the calls to end sexual based violence and stop discrimination of the LGBTI community, and that more needs to be done to end human rights abuses. While we cannot support the EU acting in the world, we cannot oppose calls to end abuses around the world – so we have to abstain on this report.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ The UN Secretary-General called for a first-ever World Humanitarian Summit (WHS) to be held in Istanbul in May 2016. In a world being faced with unprecedented humanitarian crisis there is a clear call to shift focus from response to prevention.

name: Sergio GUTIÉRREZ PRIETO
text: written. - Socialists have managed to consolidate a progressive position for the next World Humanitarian Summit (Istanbul, May 2016), we emphasize the key elements to reform the current humanitarian aid system, such as: guaranteeing the defense of humanitarian principles and the impartiality of aid from a political point of view and put mechanisms in place to ensure that governments are held accountable for their roles and responsibilities in the area of ​​protecting the most vulnerable. As key measures it is proposed: a global consensus for humanitarian action, greater transparency and accountability regarding the use of aid, a code of conduct for donors and a global fund that ensures and facilitates sufficient means to tackle crises such as Ebola or that of Syrian refugees. We regret that the extremist groups (left and right) of the European Parliament have not supported this report or have abstained, without betting on the protection of the most vulnerable, human dignity and respect for human rights. They have neglected the empowerment of women, the education of children and the protection of migrants and refugees in emergencies.

name: András GYÜRK
text: in writing. - Currently, the world has to deal with an unprecedented amount of humanitarian crisis. The length and severity of these crises are also unprecedented. As a result, there are now more refugees and internally displaced persons than after World War II. In May 2016, at the initiative of UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon, the first humanitarian summit will be held in Istanbul to transform the current humanitarian system, making it more efficient and adapting to the new challenges. The report seeks to provide clear guidelines for this, especially with regard to food security, population growth and climate change. In addition to reducing vulnerability and managing risk, the report places great emphasis on transforming through innovation and making funding more transparent. The report calls for the adoption of a five-year draft as a final document for the conference, setting out political commitments in the field of development.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: GUE / NGL), in writing.- Humanitarian aid is an important pillar of a development policy in developing countries.The report proposes a series of measures that satisfy us.Nevertheless, in many places the report makes proposals that base humanitarian aid policies on private sector action, something with which we cannot agree.So to underline our critical support in the report, we considered that the appropriate attitude is abstention.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ I, along with ALDE, voted strongly in favour of this report. The UN Secretary-General called for a first-ever World Humanitarian Summit (WHS) to be planned to be held in Istanbul next May. In a world being faced with unprecedented humanitarian crisis there is a clear call to shift the focus from response to prevention. The aim of the summit is to determine the future agenda in the fields of international humanitarian law, humanitarian intervention and assistance, as well as to establish norms strengthening international law and practice in this domain.

name: Hans-Olaf HENKEL
text: written.- The report discusses the objectives of the European Union with regard to the first World Summit on Humanitarian Aid, which will take place on 23/24May 2016 in Istanbul.The report contains a number of good recommendations.A five-year action plan is to be adopted, a link to the international development agenda established and humanitarian aid, especially in refugee camps, to be noticeably improved.On the other hand, there are also problematic parts.Among other things, mandatory funding is required from the donor countries, without specifying how these mandatory payments are controlled, who is responsible for them and how high the respective amount will be for the donor country in question.Against this background, I have abstained from voting.I also believe that the single euro must be abolished.It leads to discord and dissension in Europe.

name: György HÖLVÉNYI
text: in writing. - As today's report states, there is an unprecedented need for humanitarian aid worldwide today. The number of people in need has reached unprecedented proportions. So when we discuss ways to help, we can only think in comprehensive partnerships. My personal experience is that the Middle East is one of the focal points for assistance today. In the refugee camps in Iraq, I have found it confusing that the EU does not build on the capacity and infrastructure of local church communities and their aid organizations when carrying out projects. Recognized organizations such as Aid to the Church in Need have implemented projects in the area worth more than € 40 million. They have a total of 38 different programs running in Iraq alone and more than 100 in Syria. They successfully provide basic needs for hundreds of thousands, such as housing, education or employment. It is worth looking at these results because these are the two countries from which current immigration originated and are still heading towards Europe. Today, the Union must make a huge effort to give the needy a perspective in their own country. It is also in the interests of the persecuted. The Union must therefore amend the rules on aid so that those most affected, including religious minorities who are suffering persecution, can be involved in aid projects. It is remarkable that today's report calls for a rethink of international humanitarian aid, which is why I voted in favor of it.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: in writing. ‒ The world is being faced with humanitarian crises, unprecedented both in their number, scale and persistence. I have voted in favour of this report that will continue to emphasise the essential role of the NGOs in humanitarian action and to ensure that their views are taken into consideration throughout the process and reflected in the outcome.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report on the preparations for the World Humanitarian Summit: challenges and opportunities for providing humanitarian aid, because we are witnessing that in everyday life the challenges are becoming more difficult due to urbanization, rapid population growth, demographic change, frequency and increased intensity of natural resources.disasters, environmental destruction, climate change, numerous protracted conflicts that take place simultaneously and affect all regions, and cause resource scarcity, poverty, inequality, migration, displacement and instability.That is why we come to the need to provide a humanitarian response, and this report also welcomes the UN's initiative to gather intelligence from around the world to prevent natural disasters and to find a way to save and protect more people from the consequences of variouskind of crisis.

name: Diane JAMES
text: in writing. – My colleagues and I abstained on this non-legislative and non-binding report. UKIP does not recognise the legitimacy of or support the EU acting on behalf of the UK in any international capacity. The report calls for a new fund to be created to which financial contributions would be compulsory. It called for a European action plan and that the private sector align with EU development objectives. However we fully support the calls to end sexual based violence and stop discrimination of the LGBTI community, and that more needs to be done to end human rights abuses. While we cannot support the EU acting in the world, we cannot oppose calls to end abuses around the world – so we have to abstain on this report.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report by my colleague Enrique Guerrero Salom on the challenges and prospects for humanitarian assistance in preparation for the world humanitarian summit.The resolution calls for the insertion of a five-year roadmap that will complement the outcome document of the World Humanitarian Summit.It also emphasizes the complementarity of humanitarian aid with development aid, which must be strengthened.250 million people are indeed affected by humanitarian crises and the number of displaced people is at its highest level since World War II, hence the urgency of humanitarian issues today.This report was adopted, which I welcome.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report, which aims to make a clear contribution to the first world humanitarian summit in Istanbul from 23 to 24 May 2016.This report also highlights the complementarity between humanitarian aid and development aid.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: written.- I am voting against this report.The term “those in need of protection” is being expanded very widely, and the required rights to intervene in the integration of private funds into humanitarian aid and in the administrative sector go too far.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report. The EU, as the leading donor and key global player in humanitarian action, has both a responsibility and the necessary leverage to take a leadership role in the quest for more efficient and effective ways to meet the needs of those affected by conflicts and disasters. It should consider the WHS as an opportunity to build partnerships and find common ground on humanitarian principles and international standards, and to enhance cooperation and coordination of assistance.

name: Bernd KÖLMEL
text: written.- The report discusses the objectives of the European Union with regard to the first World Summit on Humanitarian Aid, which will take place on 23/24May 2016 in Istanbul.The report contains a number of good recommendations.A five-year action plan is to be adopted, a link to the international development agenda established and humanitarian aid, especially in refugee camps, to be noticeably improved.On the other hand, there are also problematic parts.Among other things, mandatory funding is required from the donor countries, without specifying how these mandatory payments are controlled, who is responsible for them and how high the respective amount will be for the donor country in question.Against this background, I have abstained from voting.

text: in writing. - Currently, the world has to deal with an unprecedented amount of humanitarian crisis. The length and severity of these crises are also unprecedented. As a result, there are now more refugees and internally displaced persons than after World War II. In May 2016, at the initiative of UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon, the first humanitarian summit will be held in Istanbul, aimed at transforming the current humanitarian system, making it more efficient and adapting to new challenges. name: Stelios KOULOGLOU
text: in writing. ‒ The report aims to set out the European Parliament position towards the WHS in order to influence the EU’s common position on the summit. Among our amendments were those highlighting climate change, inequalities and economic violence as root causes of the humanitarian crisis, stressing the need for especial protection of women and girls and LGTBI people, and calling for the need to ensure women and girls access to the full range of sexual and reproductive health services, including safe abortions. However, the report calls for further cooperation between private sector actors in humanitarian actions, and for instance calls on the EU to explore and encourage partnerships with start-ups, and with insurance and technology companies, amongst others, with a view to developing tools for preparedness and deployment in emergencies. The report calls on the Member States to better integrate business into their respective national emergency response plans. Being also the shadow rapporteur I voted abstention.

name: Agnieszka KOZŁOWSKA
text: in writing. - In the report on preparation for the humanitarian summit and the challenges and opportunities for humanitarian aid, I voted for the recognition of women's reproductive rights and for access to the full range of services in this field, including legal and safe abortion. During humanitarian crises, such as during armed conflicts, mass rape of women and even children is frequent; rape is used as a weapon of war. The prohibition of termination of pregnancy, which arose in such circumstances, means forcing women to bear children whose fathers are soldiers of the hostile army, often the torturers and murderers of people from their immediate family or those closest Even the most restrictive legislation, such as the Polish anti-abortion law, allows abortion in a situation where pregnancy is a result of rape. It would be inhumane to not give such a right to women who have been raped during hostilities. In the absence of access to legal, safe abortion, desperate women cope without doctors, which ends up losing health and even life. According to WHO, illegal abortion in countries affected by a humanitarian crisis is one of the most common causes of death for women, therefore it is the duty of those who help in such situations to save women, victims of rape used as a weapon of war.

name: Ilhan KYUCHYUK
text: in writing. – I supported the resolution because for one reason or another, there are ongoing humanitarian crises all over the world. In this context, the upcoming World Humanitarian Summit is our opportunity to change not only the life of affected people but also to bring back humanity and human rights to the top of our agenda.  Seen in this light the EU, as the biggest aid donor in the world and human rights champion, must take the leading role in upcoming meeting. Perhaps what is more important is the fact that as a leading power at the summit the EU must offer to the summit participants new innovative measures, policies and instruments to tackle ongoing humanitarian crises. Leadership is not an easy thing therefore we must prepare for it if we would like to continue to be world’s leading humanitarian power.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: in writing.- I abstained on this report.Of course, it has the merit of seeking to develop humanitarian aid.However, many people need it.But it is polluted by a certain angelism with regard to migrants, and by the desire to develop "public / private partnerships" which are nevertheless sources of abuse and financial abuses.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: in writing. - Despite a rather promising approach to the new perspectives of humanitarian aid, by insisting in particular on prevention rather than ad hoc management which is often costly and which does not help the empowerment of the affected countries, this report is in reality polluted by claims having no direct link with our subject. There was thus an opinion particularly oriented on sex education and "education for relationship life", as well as several LGBT demands. Finally, if the summit is to concern all populations affected by a crisis, migrants and the desire to offer them special protection are predominant in the text. The injunction to the Member States to increase their funding, but also to implement without delay the measures that will be taken at the summit, notably with a "comprehensive plan for the reception of refugees", is one of the main characteristics of this text. , just like the call for the contribution of the private sector within the framework of the financing of humanitarian aid. I abstained on this tricky report.

name: Javi LÓPEZ
text: written. - I voted in favor of the report on the preparation for the World Humanitarian Summit: challenges and opportunities for humanitarian aid, since it represents a positive impulse from the European Parliament to the holding of the first World Humanitarian Summit, which will be developed in four blocks on which the report's recommendations revolve, the preparation of which has been reinforced with a study, working sessions with more than 30 humanitarian organizations and actors located in the field, and with meetings with the Commissioners and General Directorates of Budget and Humanitarian Action. The report therefore collects the main concerns of a sector that is threatened by the unprecedented increase in conflicts and disasters, the lack of means, access and protection. Likewise, the Council is urged to ensure a firm common position so that our voice is heard globally, and we are not only recognized as one of the largest donors, but also as a body that assumes responsibilities and leads by example. .

name: Juan Fernando LÓPEZ AGUILAR
